entries: 隱居在高聳群山的大樹之顛，有時又被稱作鳥人的阿蘭寇拉鷹人，總能喚起人們的恐懼和驚奇。許多阿蘭寇拉鷹人並不是原生自物質位面的生物。他們來自另一個遙遠的世界──來自那氣元素位面的無邊蒼穹。他們是移民、難民、斥候、以及探索者，他們的前哨基地則做為他們探索這個奇特而陌生世界的立足點。

entries.name: 喙與羽
entries: 從地上看，飛行中的阿蘭寇拉鷹人就如同一隻大鳥。只有當他們降落棲息於樹枝或行走於地面時，他們才會揭露其類人生物的一面。阿蘭寇拉鷹人站立時的身高可達5呎，且他們具有一雙細長，末端漸變成鋒利禽爪的雙腿。
他們的身體披覆著羽毛。他們全身鳥羽的樣式通常代表著他們所屬的部落。男性個體的羽色較為鮮豔，通常為紅色、橘色、或黃色。女性則有著較為柔和的羽色，通常為棕色或灰色。他們的頭部完全就是鳥禽的外貌，如同鸚鵡或是鷹隼，且根據部落不同而有明顯差異。

entries.name: 蒼空看守者
entries: 沒有別處比天空更能讓阿蘭寇拉鷹人感到自在。他們可以在空中待上數個小時、而有些甚至會在空中長達數天，伸展它們的雙翼以讓上升氣流帶著他們翺翔天際。在戰鬥中，他們會展現出靈動自如的飛行特技，以驚人的速度和優雅穿梭，向著敵人俯衝降下武器或禽爪，在迅速迴轉並飛掠遠去。
一旦展翅飛翔，阿蘭寇拉鷹人便不怎麼願意再離開天空。在他們的原生位面，他們可以持續飛行數天或甚至數個月，且只會在產卵和餵養幼崽時才會降落地面，並隨之迅速回到空中。那些來到物質位面世界中的阿蘭寇拉鷹人都覺得這裡是個奇怪的地方。他們有時候會忘記或忽略垂直高度的距離影響，且他們對那些被迫束縛於地面生活勞作的人們只有滿滿的同情。

entries.name: 禽鳥習性
entries: 阿蘭寇拉鷹人與鳥類的相似性不僅限於身體特徵。他們有著許多與尋常鳥類相同的習性。阿蘭寇拉鷹人對於他們的鳥羽相當苛求挑剔，且會頻繁地照料他們的羽毛、清潔並挑去任何他們可能沾染上的微小過客。當他們屈尊從空中降於地面時，通常都會在水池附近這麼做，好讓他們可以抓魚並清潔自己。
許多阿蘭寇拉鷹人都會在他們說話時以啾啾聲強調重點並加深語意，其作用與人類的面部表情和肢體動作類似。一名阿蘭寇拉鷹人可能會對那些無法分辨其中差異的人們感到沮喪；阿蘭寇拉鷹人的出言威脅也可能因此被當作開玩笑，反之亦然。
大部分的阿蘭寇拉鷹人都對所有權的概念感到困惑。畢竟，又有誰能擁有天空呢？即使當有人向他們解釋，他們一開始仍會認為所有權的概念相當神秘難懂。
也因此，那些很少與其他人交流的阿蘭寇拉鷹人很可能會被當作討厭鬼，尤其是當他們從空中飛下帶走牲畜、或當他們掠奪那些豐收的果實和穀物時更為如此。閃閃發亮的物體總能吸引他們的目光。他們很難抗拒收穫財寶，並將之帶回去美化據點的慾望。不過，那些與其他種族生活數年之久的阿蘭寇拉鷹人多多少少學會了抑制這種衝動。
阿蘭寇拉鷹人懼怕受到監禁。被束縛在地面、困在地下、或囚禁在冰冷堅硬的大地中，對阿蘭寇拉鷹人來說都是難以忍受的折磨。即使當他們停歇在高處枝頭、或在他們山巔的家園中休息，他們也都會保持警覺，四處張望並隨時準備起身高飛。

entries.name: 家園
entries: 大部分的阿蘭寇拉鷹人都居住在氣元素位面。他們有時候會進入物質位面以追尋敵人、或在該處挫敗他們敵人的計畫。一些意外事故也可能會讓一整巢的阿蘭寇拉鷹人墜入物質位面的世界。其中一些則可能會在他們的位面中自己找到通往這類世界的傳送門，並在該處的高山或遠古樹林巔峰建立起自己的巢穴。
當數個阿蘭寇拉鷹人部族定居在同個區域，他們會共享同一個狩獵區，其區域範圍可以擴展到最多100哩的距離。每個部族都會在距離他們聚落最近的土地上狩獵，在獵物稀缺時才進一步擴大狩獵範圍。
一個典型的聚落會由一個由籐蔓編織而成的巨大、開放式鳥巢所構成。其中最年長的個體會在薩滿的支持下擔任領袖。

entries.name: 被遺忘國度的阿蘭寇拉鷹人
entries: 從未在費倫確立腳步，阿蘭寇拉鷹人僅僅具有四個主要的聚落，分別位於：至高森林(High Forest)的星之山脈(Star Mounts)、科米爾的風暴之角(Storm Horns)、維洪海域(Vilhon Reach)的裂隙山脈(Cloven Mountains)、以及朱特(Chult)的迷霧絕壁(Mistcliffs)。
那些在星之山脈，靠近德沙林穀地(Dessarin Valley)所建立的聚落中住著一群隱密而戒備森嚴的族群，只有在他們飛越至高森林的途中才會被偶爾目擊。一頭殘暴而貪婪的綠龍曾幾乎將整個聚落消滅殆盡，並使倖存者四散各地。這些阿蘭寇拉鷹人和他們的子嗣誓言對這條龍展開復仇，且他們搜索敵人的身影可能會在北地和科米爾區域被目擊。
他們唯一殘存的聚落座落在星之山脈最南端的山坡上。在獨角獸奔流(Unicorn Run)的上游源頭，那被稱作終末鷹巢(the Last Aerie)的場所是數十名阿蘭寇拉鷹人的家園。而在最近，阿蘭寇拉鷹人的長老們察覺到了盛行風向的變化，並將其視為一個不好的預兆。
不像其他世界中位於物質位面的阿蘭寇拉鷹人，被遺忘國度中的阿蘭寇拉鷹人鮮少返回氣元素位面。

entries.name: 崇高的理想
entries: 阿蘭寇拉鷹人享受和平與遺世獨立的生活。他們大部分都沒什麼興趣和其他人交流，也不願意花費時間參與地面上的活動。也因此，要讓阿蘭寇拉鷹人離開他或她的部族並開始冒險生涯，會需要一些較為極端的狀況。無論財寶或榮燿都不足以誘使他們離開部落；只有威脅著他們人民的危險、復仇的使命、或者重大災難，才會是促使阿蘭寇拉鷹人冒險者們選擇這條道路的主要原因。
另外兩種狀況也可能會使阿蘭寇拉鷹人出發冒險。第一，阿蘭寇拉鷹人與艾誇的風之公爵一族有著歷史性的深刻淵源。一些傑出的個體會以這種聯繫為榮，並可能會尋找七節權杖(Rod of Seven Parts)的遺失殘骸。這把由風之公爵一族所塑造的神器在久遠以前曾被用以擊敗混沌之後(Queen of Chaos)的怪物擁護者：狼蛛密斯卡(Miska the Wolf-Spider)。
當這把權杖被插進密斯卡的軀體時，牠血液中的混沌切裂了這把權杖，並將它的碎片散落在多元宇宙中。收復這些碎片，意味著從打造了權杖的瓦蒂一族(vaati)中贏得榮譽和敬重，同時也可能藉此恢復一把將用於抵抗邪惡元素勢力的強大武器。

第二，阿蘭寇拉鷹人將土元素生物視為死敵，特別是那些侍奉於土之親王歐雷莫奇(Ogremoch, the Prince of Earth)的石像鬼。阿蘭寇拉鷹人的語言中對於這些石像鬼的稱呼可以被籠統翻譯作「飛行岩塊」，阿蘭寇拉鷹人與石像鬼之間的戰爭爆發在土元素位面和氣元素位面，且偶爾會蔓延到物質位面的世界中。在這個位面的阿蘭寇拉鷹人可能會離開他們的聚落，並幫助其他類人生物以對抗土之邪教徒，並阻撓他們的陰謀。

entries.name: 阿蘭寇拉鷹人名字
entries: 就如同他們的說話方式，阿蘭寇拉鷹人的名字包括了一些咂舌音、顫音、和哨音，以至於其他人有些難以念出他們名字的發音。通常來說，一個阿蘭寇拉鷹人的名字具有二到四個音節，以及用作連接這些音節的發音。當與其他種族互動時，阿蘭寇拉鷹人可能會使用別人為他們取的暱稱、或他們全名的簡稱，以方便他人稱呼。
一名任意性別的阿蘭寇拉鷹人都可能會擁有下列其中一個簡名：埃拉(Aera)、艾歐(Aial)、奧爾(Aur)、迪凱(Deekek)、厄克(Errk)、希克(Heehk)、伊奇(Ikki)、克里克(Kleeck)、歐爾(Oorr)、烏斯(Ouss)、誇夫(Quaf)、奎爾克(Quierk)、索里克(Salleek)、厄里克(Urreek)、或齊德(Zeed)。

entries.name: 阿蘭寇拉鷹人背景
entries: 最適合阿蘭寇拉鷹人的背景包括了化外之民、隱士、和學者。
阿蘭寇拉鷹人的小型聚落通常偏遠而與世隔絕，且只有很少的阿蘭寇拉鷹人會離巢而居。在被遺忘國度那至高森林(High Forest)的星之山脈(Star Mounts)中，有不超過數十個的阿蘭寇拉鷹人居住在遠離他們家巢的地方。這些離巢而居的個體通常是遊俠或戰士，時常在外巡邏以戒備外來的威脅。
阿斯莫的靈魂承載著天堂之光。天堂山(Mount Celestia)是許多守序善良諸神所在的神聖國度，而阿斯莫正是那些被源自該處的神聖力量所祝福人類的後裔。阿斯莫生來就是為要做為諸神的戰士，他們的誕生也被視為一種祝福。他們那超凡脫俗且帶有散發光芒的面容揭示了他們繼承自天界的血脈。

entries.name: 墮落，或重獲恩寵
entries: 在DM的同意下，若你的守護者/天譴阿斯莫轉變為邪惡陣營，則你可以將你角色的亞種改變為墮落阿斯莫。若你這麼做，則將你的亞種特性和好處（包括屬性值提升）全部替換為墮落阿斯莫的。
同樣的，若你的墮落阿斯莫轉變為善良陣營，你的DM可能會允許你使其成為一名守護者或天譴阿斯莫。

entries.name: 天界勇士
entries: 阿斯莫來到世上是為成為律法和善良的守護者。他們的眷主期許他們打擊邪惡，以身作則，並促進正義的發展。
從童年開始，阿斯莫便會透過夢境接收到來自天界存在的引領和指導。這些夢境有助於塑造阿斯莫的性格，賦予他們使命感和對公義的渴望。
每個阿斯莫都可以依靠一名諸神派遣來的天界代理人做為其嚮導。這個存在通常會是一名梵天神侍：一名在凡間做為信使的天使。

entries.name: 隱蔽的流浪者
entries: 儘管阿斯莫身為一切邪惡的敵人，他們通常偏好保持低調。一名阿斯莫無可避免地會吸引邪教徒、邪魔、和其他善良之敵的註意力，而他們全都渴望逮到機會，將天界勇士狠狠擊潰。
當旅行在外時，阿斯莫偏好戴上兜帽、封閉式頭盔、和其他能夠隱藏他們身分的裝備。儘管如此，他們對於公開打擊邪惡不會有絲毫後悔。即使他們渴望隱蔽，但這永遠不值得讓無辜者因此受到傷害。

entries.name: 阿斯莫嚮導
entries: 除了已經墮入邪惡的個體之外，每個阿斯莫的都連結著一名天使。儘管這種聯繫只能在夢中發揮作用，這個天使—通常是梵天神侍—會藉此為其阿斯莫提供指導。這種指導並不是以直接的命令或單純話語呈現，相反的，阿斯莫所接收到的會是異象、預言、或感情。
這名天使並非無所不知。他們的指導往往是基於他們所理解的秩序和良善，且可能會對如何打擊他們所知道的強大邪惡提供其見解。
作為充實阿斯莫角色的一部分，思考一下該角色所聯繫的天使嚮導的特質。天使嚮導表中提供了一些名字和特質，做為你創建你角色嚮導的參考。

瑪蘭達爾(Myllandra)
賽拉菲娜(Seraphina)
葛拉迪亞(Galladia)
麥奇歐(Mykiel)
瓦蘭卓斯(Valandras)
迂腐，諄諄教訓的

entries.name: 給DM的筆記：扮演天使嚮導
entries: 做為DM，你將負責扮演阿斯莫的天使嚮導，並決定要在夢境中給予他什麼樣的建議或預兆。
這是你將扮演梵天神侍、或其他天界生物等特殊角色加到遊戲中的大好機會。謹記，梵天神侍居住在一個純粹守序和善良的國度。他們可能無法理解凡人在這個世界上所必須面對的妥協或艱難抉擇。對梵天神侍來說，阿斯莫既是他們可貴的學生，就必須達到他們有時近乎苛刻的高標準。

entries.name: 矛盾的靈魂
entries: 儘管源於天界，阿斯莫仍是凡人，並擁有自己的自由意志。大部分的阿斯莫會追隨他們既定的道路，但其中有些人則會逐漸將他們的能力視作一種詛咒。這些叛逆的阿斯莫通常僅會滿足於遠離這個世界的紛擾，但也有一小部分人會誠為邪惡的使徒。在他們來看，他們所接觸到的天界之力幾乎與洗腦無異。
邪惡的阿斯莫將成為致命的敵人，他們曾經掌握的光輝力量如今腐化成了一種乾枯可怖的魔力。且他們的天使嚮導已經完全放棄了他們。
即使是完全獻身於善良的阿斯莫，有時候也會感覺自己被撕裂於兩個世界之間。那些指導他們的天使們從遙遠的高處俯瞰這個世界。因此，當一名阿斯莫希望停下腳步以幫助邨莊從乾旱中恢復時，他們的天使嚮導則可能會指示他們前去執行更崇高的使命。對於這些遙遠的天使而言，拯救幾個平民與摧毀奧喀斯信徒的邪教團體相比，無疑是微不足道的。儘管阿斯莫的嚮導充滿智慧，但並非絕無正確。

entries.name: 阿斯莫名字
entries: 大部分的阿斯莫出生於人類家庭，且他們通常會使用與他們原生文化相同的命名習慣。
An aasimar who was touched by dark powers as a youth or who turns to evil in early adulthood can become one of the fallen-a group of aasimar whose inner light has been replaced by shadow.

Protector aasimar are charged by the powers of good to guard the weak, to strike at evil wherever it arises, and to stand vigilant against the darkness. From a young age, a protector aasimar receives advice and directives that urge to stand against evil.

Scourge aasimar are imbued with a divine energy that blazes intensely within them. It feeds a powerful desire to destroy evil-a desire that is, at its best, unflinching and, at its worst, all-consuming. Many scourge aasimar wear masks to block out the world and focus on containing this power, unmasking themselves only in battle.

In the sprawling city of Ravnica, where "open road" seems like a contradiction and "open plain" is sheer nonsense, centaurs nevertheless retain a love of wide spaces and the freedom to travel. As much as they can, centaurs run—in wide plazas, spacious parks, and expanses of rubble and ruin. They race the wind, hooves thundering and tails streaming behind them, until the next wall looms in their path and brings them to a stop.

entries.name: Nature's Cavalry
entries: Centaurs have the upper bodies, down to the waist, of muscular humans, displaying all the human variety of skin tones and features. Their ears are slightly pointed, but their faces are wider and squarer than those of elves. Below the waist, they have the bodies of small horses, with a similar range of coloration—from various shades of chestnut or bay to dappled or even zebra-like striped patterns. Most centaurs style their hair and their tails in a similar way. Selesnya centaurs favor long, flowing hair. Gruul centaurs cut their hair in rough, spiky styles.

The upper bodies of centaurs are comparable to human torsos in size, and their lower equine bodies average about 4 feet tall at the withers. Though they are smaller than a human rider mounted on a horse, they fill similar roles as cavalry warriors, messengers, outriders, and scouts.

entries.name: Affinity for Nature
entries: Centaurs have an affinity for the natural world. Among the guilds that share that affinity, centaurs favor the rubblebelts of the Gruul Clans and the wide plazas of the Selesnya Conclave over the undercity tunnels of the Golgari and the laboratories of the Simic.

Centaurs celebrate life and growth, and the birth of a foal is always cause for festivities. At the same time, they revere the traditions of the past, and among both the Gruul and the Selesnya they are voices of memory and history, preserving old ways and keeping alive the legends of ancestral heroes. They feel a close kinship with wild animals, perhaps because of their own horse-like bodies, and delight in the feeling of running alongside herds and packs of other beasts.

entries.name: Clans and Community
entries: Centaurs sense the interconnectedness of the natural world. Thus, they celebrate family and community as microcosms of that greater connection. Among the Gruul, they have a strong clan identity, and Selesnya centaurs are fiercely loyal to their individual communities as well as the guild as a whole. Their love of history and tradition also means that centaurs are more likely than most other Ravnicans to join the same guild that their parents did.

entries.name: Centaur Names
entries: Centaurs' given names are passed down through family lines. The name bestowed on a new foal is typically the name of the most recently deceased family member of the same gender, keeping alive the memory—and, the centaurs believe, some shard of the spirit—of the departed. Centaurs don't use family names, but they wear symbols that represent their family membership. These symbols might include graphical representations of plants or animals, printed mottoes, braids and beads worn in the hair and tail, or even specific patterns of woven fabric.

entries: In the sprawling city of Ravnica, where "open road" seems like a contradiction and "open plain" is sheer nonsense, centaurs nevertheless retain a love of wide spaces and the freedom to travel. As much as they can, centaurs run—in wide plazas, spacious parks, and expanses of rubble and ruin. They race the wind, hooves thundering and tails streaming behind them, until the next wall looms in their path and brings them to a stop.

entries.name: Nature's Cavalry
entries: Centaurs have the upper bodies, down to the waist, of muscular humans, displaying all the human variety of skin tones and features. Their ears are slightly pointed, but their faces are wider and squarer than those of elves. Below the waist, they have the bodies of small horses, with a similar range of coloration—from various shades of chestnut or bay to dappled or even zebra-like striped patterns. Most centaurs style their hair and their tails in a similar way. Selesnya centaurs favor long, flowing hair. Gruul centaurs cut their hair in rough, spiky styles.

The upper bodies of centaurs are comparable to human torsos in size, and their lower equine bodies average about 4 feet tall at the withers. Though they are smaller than a human rider mounted on a horse, they fill similar roles as cavalry warriors, messengers, outriders, and scouts.

entries.name: Affinity for Nature
entries: Centaurs have an affinity for the natural world. Among the guilds that share that affinity, centaurs favor the rubblebelts of the Gruul Clans and the wide plazas of the Selesnya Conclave over the undercity tunnels of the Golgari and the laboratories of the Simic.

Centaurs celebrate life and growth, and the birth of a foal is always cause for festivities. At the same time, they revere the traditions of the past, and among both the Gruul and the Selesnya they are voices of memory and history, preserving old ways and keeping alive the legends of ancestral heroes. They feel a close kinship with wild animals, perhaps because of their own horse-like bodies, and delight in the feeling of running alongside herds and packs of other beasts.

entries.name: Clans and Community
entries: Centaurs sense the interconnectedness of the natural world. Thus, they celebrate family and community as microcosms of that greater connection. Among the Gruul, they have a strong clan identity, and Selesnya centaurs are fiercely loyal to their individual communities as well as the guild as a whole. Their love of history and tradition also means that centaurs are more likely than most other Ravnicans to join the same guild that their parents did.

The name bestowed on a new foal is typically the name of the most recently deceased family member of the same gender, keeping alive the memory—and, the centaurs believe, some shard of the spirit—of the departed. Centaurs don't use family names, but they wear symbols that represent their family membership. These symbols might include graphical representations of plants or animals, printed mottoes, braids and beads worn in the hair and tail, or even specific patterns of woven fabric.

entries: Long ago there was a woman named Jes, and she had one hundred children. Her rivals conspired against her and swore to kill her children. Jes begged the Sovereigns for help, but their only answer was the wind and rain. In the depths of her despair, a lonely traveler took her hand. "I will protect your children if they follow my path. Let them wander the world. They may be shunned and feared, but they will never be destroyed." Jes agreed, and the traveler gave her his cloak. When she draped it over her children, their old faces melted away and they could be whoever they wanted to be. And so it remains. Though the children are shunned by all, the gift of the Traveler protects them still.

Changelings can shift their forms with a thought. Many changelings use this gift as a form of artistic and emotional expression. It's also an invaluable tool for grifters, spies, and others who wish to deceive. This leads many people to treat changelings with suspicion.

entries.name: A Hidden People
entries: Wherever humans live, changelings reside also; the question is whether their presence is known.

Changelings are born to one of three paths. A few are raised in stable communities where changelings are true to their nature and deal openly with the people around them. Some are orphans, raised by other races, who find their way in the world without ever knowing another like themselves. Others are part of nomadic changeling clans spread across the Five Nations, families who keep their true nature hidden from the single-skins. Some clans maintain safe havens in major cities and communities, but most prefer to wander the unpredictable path of the god known as the Traveler.

In creating a changeling adventurer, consider the character's relationships with people around them. Does the character conceal their true changeling nature? Do they embrace it? Do they have connections to other changelings or are they alone and in search of companions?

entries.name: Masks and Personas
entries: In their true form, changelings are pale, with colorless eyes and silver-white hair. It is rare to see a changeling in that form, for a typical changeling changes their shape the way others might change clothes. A casual shape—one created on the spur of the moment, with no depth or history—is called a mask. A mask can be used to express a mood or to serve a specific purpose and then might never be used again. However, many changelings develop identities that have more depth. They build an identity over time, crafting a persona with a history and beliefs. This focused identity helps a changeling pinpoint a particular skill or emotion. A changeling adventurer might have personas for many situations, including negotiation, investigation, and combat.

Personas can be shared by multiple changelings; there might be three healers in a community, but whoever is on duty will adopt the persona of Tek, the kindly old medic. Personas can even be passed down through a family, allowing a younger changeling to take advantage of contacts established by the persona's previous users.

entries.name: Changeling Names
entries: A changeling might use a different name for each mask and persona and adopt new names as easily as they change faces. The true name of a changeling tends to be simple and monosyllabic; however, there are often accents to a changeling's name that are expressed through shapeshifting, something single-skins will likely miss. So, two changelings might have the name {@i Jin}, but one is {@i Jin-with-vivid-blue-eyes} and one is {@i Jin-with-golden-nails}.
Changelings have a fluid relationship with gender, seeing it as one characteristic to change among many.

Poised between the worlds of the living and the dead, dhampirs retain their grip on life yet are endlessly tested by vicious hungers. Their ties to the undead grant dhampirs a taste of a vampire's deathless prowess in the form of increased speed, {@sense darkvision}, and a life-draining bite. With unique insights into the nature of the undead, many dhampirs turn to the lives of adventurers and monster hunters. Their reasons are often deeply personal. Some seek danger, imagining monsters as personifications of their own hungers. Others pursue revenge against whatever turned them into a dhampir. And still others embrace the solitude of the hunt, striving to distance themselves from those who'd tempt their hunger.

entries.name: Dhampir Hungers
entries: Every dhampir knows a thirst slaked only by the living. This desire is a whisper in the mind, a tinge to the sight, a reflex constantly needing to be suppressed. Those who overindulge their thirst risk losing control and forever viewing others as prey. Those who resist might find exceptional ways of controlling their urges or suppress it through constant, molar-grinding restraint. In any case, temptation haunts dhampirs, and circumstances conspire to give them endless reasons to indulge.

While many dhampirs thirst for blood, your character might otherwise gain sustenance from the living. Roll on or choose an option from the Dhampir Hungers table to determine what tempts your character to feed.

entries.caption: Dhampir Hungers
rows: Blood
Flesh or raw meat
Cerebral spinal fluid
Esoteric humors
Psychic energy
A color from one's appearance
Dreams
Life energy

entries.name: Dhampir Origins
entries: Dhampirs often arise from encounters with vampires, but all manner of macabre bargains, necromantic influences, and encounters with mysterious immortals might have transformed your character. The Dhampir Origins table provides suggestions for how your character gained their lineage.

entries.caption: Dhampir Origins
rows: You are the reincarnation of an ancestor who was a vampiric tyrant.
Your pact with a predatory deity, fiend, fey, or spirit causes you to share their hunger.
You survived being attacked by a vampire but were forever changed.
A parasite inhabits your body. You indulge your hunger to sate it.
You loved an immortal and were willing to be transformed into a vampire to join them, but tragedy interrupted the transformation.
You are a diminished manifestation of an otherworldly being. Slaking your hunger hastens your renewal.
You don't know your origins, but you were raised by vampires or other monsters.
A radical experiment changed your body, making you reliant on others for vital fluids.

entries: 生而為龍，就如其名所示，龍裔承受著眾人對他們的畏懼和誤解，驕傲地行走在世界上。由龍神或巨龍所創造，龍裔最初是從龍蛋中做為一支獨特種族而生，並結合了龍族與類人生物最優秀的一面。一些龍裔是真龍最忠實的使徒，而其他人則在偉大戰爭中集結成軍，還有一些人，則是漫無目的地四處漂泊。

entries.name: 龍族之傲
entries: 龍裔看起來非常像是以類人型態直行站立的龍族，但他們並沒有翅膀和尾巴。首個誕生的龍裔有著色調與其龍族近親相符的鮮豔鱗片，但在世代混血的影響下，他們逐漸有了更為一致的外觀。他們小巧精細的鱗片通常是青銅或黃銅色，有時則會是腥紅、鐵鏽色、或銅綠色。他們的身形高大而強壯，身高通常接近6呎半，且重約300磅或以上。他們的手腳是強健而尖銳的爪子，每隻手都有著三根指爪和一個大拇指。
在某些龍裔氏族中，特定龍族血統的影響會特別強烈。這些龍裔通常相當誇燿他們那與龍族先祖更為相近的鱗片──如五色龍般的鮮紅色、綠色、藍色、白色、亮黑色、或者金屬般的金色、銀色、黃銅、赤銅、或青銅色。

entries.name: 氏族之傲
entries: 對每個龍裔而言，氏族都比自己的性命更為重要。龍裔對其氏族的感恩和敬重遠超一切，甚至高過諸神。每個龍裔的行為都會反映出他或她氏族的榮燿，且使氏族蒙羞將會導致驅逐和流放的下場。每個龍裔都知曉他們在自己氏族中的身分和使命，且榮譽將驅使他們堅守其身分。
他們對自我完善的恆久追求也反映了整個種族的自負。龍裔重視技藝和對卓越的努力追求。他們厭惡失敗，且他們在竭盡全力之前，不會放棄面對任何挑戰。龍裔將精通特定技能做為其終生目標。而其他種族中同樣具有這種獻身特質的成員也更容易贏得龍裔的敬重。
儘管所有龍裔都致力於自給自足，他們仍知道到在面對艱困情境時，有時也是需要一點幫助的。但這類幫助最好還是來自氏族，而當整個氏族都需要援助時，他們會率先尋求另一個龍裔氏族的協助，而非其他種族或甚至諸神。

entries.name: 龍裔名字
entries: 龍裔在出生時會被賦予一個名字，且他們會將他們的氏族名放在其名之前以示榮燿。乳名和綽號經常在同巢親屬被做為俗名或愛稱使用。這類名字可能是為了紀念某個事件，或用以描述某個習慣。

entries.name: 龍人
entries: 在龍槍的設定中，邪惡女神塔克西絲(Takhisis)的追隨者們研發出了一種可以將金屬龍的龍蛋腐化，並生產出邪惡龍裔的黑暗儀式。這種邪惡的龍裔被稱作龍人。五種龍人分別對應著五種金屬龍，並為了塔克西絲而投入長槍之戰：他們分別是奧瑞克龍人(auraks, 金)、巴茲龍人(baaz, 黃銅)、波札克龍人(bozak, 青銅)、卡帕克龍人(kapak, 赤銅)、和希瓦克龍人(sivak, 銀)。他們並沒有其龍族噴吐武器，但具有獨特的魔法能力。

entries.items: Draconbloods possess long tails and a knack for social manipulation. They remember the days when they were once mighty conquerors.
Ravenites have no tails and a hearty physique. They remember the days when they were slaves to the draconblood, as well as the day when they overthrew their masters.

entries: 古老而莊嚴的國度，鑿入山脈深處的宏偉大廳，迴盪於深深礦井和燃燒熔爐中的鎬聲與錘響，對氏族和傳統的絕對忠誠，以及對獸人和哥布林的深仇大恨──這一切的一切都將所有矮人團結在了一起。

entries.name: 矮短而結實
entries: 勇猛而頑強，矮人們是熟練的戰士、礦工、和精通石頭與金屬的工匠。儘管他們的身高不足5呎，但矮人寬大而緊實的身材讓他們的體重往往和一個比他們高出將近2呎的人類一樣重。他們的勇氣和耐力更是能與任何身形更大的傢夥輕易抗衡。
矮人的膚色從深褐色到帶點紅的淺棕色都有，但最常見的色調是淺棕色或深古銅色，就如同泥土的某些色調一般。
他們長而樣式單純的頭髮通常是黑色、灰色、或棕色，而膚色較淺的矮人則通常有著一頭紅髮。男性矮人相當重視他們的鬍子，並因此小心的梳理它們。

entries.name: 記憶久遠，仇恨長存
entries: 矮人可以活到超過400歲，因此在矮人長者的記憶中往往會存在另一個截然不同的世界。舉例來說，一些生活在費爾巴堡（位於被遺忘國度的世界中）最年長的矮人可能還記得超過三個世紀以前，獸人們攻陷要塞並將他們放逐出去長達250年的那一天。長壽賦予了他們一種看待世界的獨特觀點，而這是人類和半身人這類短命種族所沒有的。
矮人們堅韌而頑強，就如同他們所鍾愛的群山一般，即使經過幾世紀的風吹雨打仍巍然不動。他們敬重氏族的傳統，追溯自於太古時代建立起最古老要塞的矮人先祖，且他們不會輕易放棄這些傳統。這些傳統中的一部份體現了他們對矮人諸神的虔誠，而這些神明則體現著矮人價值觀中最重要的理想：辛勤勞動、精通戰鬥、以及獻身鍛造。
矮人的個體堅定而忠誠，行動果斷且言出必行，有時候甚至會到了固執的地步。矮人大多具有強烈的正義感，且他們絕不會忘記他們所受過的恥辱。侮辱一個矮人就等同於侮辱整個矮人氏族，因此一名矮人所採取的復仇行動，很容易就會演變成捲入整個氏族的全面戰爭。

entries.name: 氏族與王國
entries: 矮人王國在群山之下延展擴張，在那裏矮人們挖掘寶石和貴金屬，並且鍛造出各種令人驚奇的物品。他們熱愛貴金屬和精美珠寶中蘊含的美麗與技藝，甚至某些矮人會放任這種熱愛墮化成貪婪。矮人們會透過交易獲得他們無法在山中找不到的財富。他們並不喜歡船隻，因此精於商貿的人類和半身人經常負責處理矮人商品的水路貿易。儘管矮人聚落相當歡迎其他種族中那些值得信賴的成員，但聚落中的某些區域仍會禁止他們進入。
矮人社會中的主要單位是氏族，且矮人們相當重視他們的社會地位。即使是遠離其所屬王國的矮人仍相當註重他們的氏族身分和聯繫，能夠辨認出有關係的矮人、並會以他們祖先的名字起誓或咒詛他人。對矮人而言，最悲慘的命運莫過於被從氏族中驅逐。
生活於其他土地上的矮人們大多是工匠，特別是武器匠、護甲匠、和珠寶匠。其中一部份則成為了傭兵或保鑣，並因為他們的勇氣和忠誠而備受歡迎。

entries.name: 諸神、黃金、與氏族
entries: 投身於冒險生涯的矮人通常是被渴望財寶的動機所驅使──可能是為了自己、為了某個特別的目的、或甚至是為了幫助他人的無私願望。其他矮人們則可能是受到神祇的命令或啟發而動身，也許是受到直接乎召、或是單純地渴望將榮燿歸給其中一位矮人諸神。氏族和先祖世系同樣是相當重要的動機。一名矮人可能會尋求光復氏族過去的榮燿、為氏族所受到的古老冤屈展開報復、或是在被放逐之後為了重獲氏族的認可而踏上冒險徵途。或者，一名矮人也可能為了尋找其偉大祖先曾經持握、但卻在幾世紀以前遺失於戰場上的戰斧而四處探索。

entries.name: 從不輕信
entries: 矮人們與其他大多數種族之間的關係還算過得去。矮人們常說：「從認識到成為朋友，差不多得花上一百年」，這句話或許有些誇張，但在某些程度上也反映了短命種族的成員（例如人類）要贏得矮人的信任是多麼的困難。

entries.name: 精靈
entries: 「依賴精靈可不是件明智的決定。你永遠猜不到精靈下一秒會幹出什麼事；當你的鎚子砸扁獸人的腦袋，他們開始唱歌和拔劍的機率一樣大。他們古怪而輕浮。他們還是有兩個優點值得一提：儘管他們沒幾個鐵匠，但那些鐵匠的確做出了相當優質的成品。此外，當獸人和哥布林從山上潮湧而出時，有個精靈在你身後倒也不差。雖然他們沒矮人那麼靠譜，但他們無疑跟我們一樣痛恨那些獸人。」

entries.name: 半身人
entries: 「確實，他們是群討人喜歡的傢夥。但是，你可曾見過半身人英雄、帝國、勝利之軍？或甚至是任何遠古以前出自半身人之手的寶藏？沒有，一個也沒有。你又怎麼能把他們當一回事？」

entries.name: 人類
entries: 「當你花了大把時間終於瞭解了一個人類，她卻也已經走到了她生命的盡頭。如果你夠幸運，她可能會留下一個心腸和手藝跟她一樣好的親人──女兒、或孫女，或許。當你終於能夠和人類成為朋友時，你卻得看著他們逝去！當他們的心冀望於某事，那麼無論那是巨龍的寶藏或帝國的王座，他們都將把那玩意兒弄到手。你不得不敬佩這種為執著獻身的精神，儘管這也往往給他們惹來一身麻煩。」

entries.name: 矮人姓名
entries: 按照傳統，矮人的名字是由氏族長老所給予。每個合適的矮人名字都曾經被使用過，且在世世代代的傳承中被重複使用。一個矮人的名字屬於氏族，而非個人。
一名濫用或使氏族之名蒙羞的矮人將被剝奪其名，且被律法禁止再使用任何矮人的名字。

entries.name: 灰矮人
entries: 在幽暗地域深處的城市居住著灰矮人，或又稱為杜爾加矮人(Duergar)。這些邪惡而行蹤隱匿的奴隸商人會為了俘虜而襲擊地表世界，並將他們的獵物販賣給幽暗地域的其他種族。他們的天生魔法能力使他們得以隱形，還可以使他們的體型暫時巨大化。

The gray dwarves, or duergar, live deep in the Underdark. After delving deeper than any other dwarves, they were enslaved by mind flayers for eons. Although they eventually won their freedom, these grim, ashen-skinned dwarves now take slaves of their own and are as tyrannical as their former masters.
Physically similar to other dwarves in some ways, duergar are wiry and lean, with black eyes and bald heads, with the males growing long, unkempt, gray beards.

Duergar value toil above all else. Showing emotions other than grim determination or wrath is frowned on in their culture, but they can sometimes seem joyful when at work. They have the typical dwarven appreciation for order, tradition, and impeccable craftsmanship, but their goods are purely utilitarian, disdaining aesthetic or artistic value.

Few duergar become adventurers, fewer still on the surface world, because they are a hidebound and suspicious race. Those who leave their subterranean cities are usually exiles. Check with your Dungeon Master to see if you can play a gray dwarf character.
灰矮人，或被稱作杜爾加矮人，生活在幽暗地域的深處。比其他矮人們更加深入地底的生活，迎來的卻是慘遭奪心魔的恆久奴役。儘管他們最終贏得了自由，但是這些陰森、灰白色皮膚的矮人如今卻使役著自己的奴隸，且殘暴程度相比他們過去的主人有過之而無不及。
在某些身體特徵上與其他矮人們相似，但灰矮人更顯削瘦而精實，他們有著漆黑的雙眼和光禿禿的腦袋，且其男性通常長著一大把又長又蓬亂的灰色鬍鬚。
灰矮人重視苦幹勝過一切。在他們的文化中，表現出冷酷決心和憤怒以外的感情是不被許可的，但他們有時在工作時看起來仍顯得愉快。他們具有和典型矮人相同的，對於秩序、傳統、完美工藝的欣賞能力，但他們排除了美學和藝術價值，只以絕對功利主義來衡量自己的商品。
由於他們是保守而多疑的種族，只有少數的灰矮人會成為冒險者，而其中只有更少的一部份會待在地表世界。通常只有放逐者才會願意離開他們的地下都市。與你的地下城主討論以確認你是否可以扮演一名灰矮人角色。

As a hill dwarf, you have keen senses, deep intuition, and remarkable resilience. The gold dwarves of Faerun in their mighty southern kingdom are hill dwarves, as are the exiled Neidar and the debased Klar of Krynn in the Dragonlance setting.
做為一名丘陵矮人，你有著敏銳的感官、精準的直覺、和過人的恢復力。費倫大陸那建立龐大南部王國的金矮人(gold dwarf)就屬於丘陵矮人。而在龍槍設定中的克萊恩世界，那遭到放逐的奈達矮人(Neidar)和被貶謫的克拉矮人(Klar)也同樣屬於丘陵矮人。

As a mountain dwarf, you're strong and hardy, accustomed to a difficult life in rugged terrain. You're probably on the tall side (for a dwarf), and tend toward lighter coloration. The shield dwarves of northern Faerun, as well as the ruling Hylar clan and the noble Daewar clan of Dragonlance, are mountain dwarves.
做為一名高山矮人，你強壯而結實，並適應於崎嶇山地的艱苦生活。你可能會有著較高的身材（矮人標準），且有著較淺的膚色。費倫大陸北部的盾矮人(shield dwarf)，以及龍槍世界中掌權的海勒氏族(Hylar)和貴族階級的達瓦氏族(Daewar)，都屬於高山矮人。
精靈們是一群有著超凡脫俗般優雅魅力的魔幻民族，他們生活在這個世界，卻又不完全屬於這裡。他們居住在那些超凡之美的場所，比如在遠古森林的深處、或在閃爍著仙精光輝的白銀尖塔之下，柔美樂音徽盪空中，而和緩芬芳則在微風中飄揚。精靈們熱愛自然和魔法、藝術和工藝、音樂和詩歌、以及這世界上一切美好的事物。

entries.name: 纖瘦而優雅
entries: 因其超凡脫俗的優雅和精緻的面容，精靈們對人類和許多其他種族而言都美得令人難以忘懷。他們的平均身高略矮於人類，範圍介於5呎到略超過6呎。他們比人類要纖瘦的多，僅僅100至145磅重。他們的男女之間的身高大略相同，且男性只比女性略重一些。
精靈的體色涵蓋了人類常見的體色範圍，且額外包括了古銅色、青銅色、幾近青白色的膚色，綠或藍的髮色，以及如一池黃金或白銀池水的雙眼。精靈沒有面部毛髮，也幾乎不長體毛。他們偏好明亮的雅致衣裝，也喜歡樣式簡潔而可愛的珠寶飾品。

entries.name: 永恆時光的視角
entries: 精靈的壽命可以超過700歲，這也讓他們一種超然的視角去看待那些可能會深深困擾短命種族的事件。他們比起興奮而更容易感到愉快，且比起貪婪更容易感到好奇。他們傾向對瑣碎的偶然保持冷漠而不為所動。然而，當他們們追求著某個目標時，無論是在任務中展開冒險、或是學習一項嶄新的技藝或藝術，精靈們也可以變得專註而堅持不懈。他們結交朋友和樹立敵人的速度很慢，且精靈們忘卻敵友的速度更慢。他們以輕衊回應些微的冒犯，並對嚴重的侮辱報以無情的復仇。
精靈們在面對危險時如同年輕樹木的枝枒一般柔韌靈活。他們相信外交和妥協能夠在分歧升級成暴力之前將之解決。眾所周知，他們會從被侵佔的林木家園中撤退，自信於他們可以簡單的等到侵入者自行離去。然而當情勢所需，精靈也會顯現出其嚴峻尚武的一面，展示其精湛洗鍊的劍術、弓術、以及戰術謀略。

entries.name: 林中秘境
entries: 大部分的精靈居住在隱於森林深處的小型邨莊。精靈們狩獵野獸、採集食物、種植蔬菜，且他們的技術和魔法讓他們得以自給自足而無須辛苦地開墾耕地。他們是天生的藝術家，能夠製作出精美的衣物和藝術品。他們對於外界的交流通常相當有限，但仍有一些精靈透過以其工藝品交易金屬而過上了不錯的日子（精靈們對於採礦毫無興趣）。
在精靈領地外能遇到的精靈們通常是旅行詩人、藝術家、或學者。人類貴族們經常會彼此競爭，以爭取精靈家庭教師傳授劍術或魔法技巧給自己的孩子們。

entries.name: 高傲但和善
entries: 儘管他們可能會表現高傲，但精靈們通常都是和善的。即使是面對那些令其大失所望的人們（大部分不是精靈）也一樣。他們總能在任何人身上找到一些優點。

entries.name: 矮人
entries: 「矮人是遲鈍、笨拙的莽夫。但儘管他們缺乏幽默、教養和禮貌，他們渾身都是勇氣。而且，我必須承認，他們之中最好的鐵匠所生產的藝術品，已經幾乎達到了精靈的高品質。」

entries.name: 半身人
entries: 「半身人是個單純快樂的民族，而這種特質不應該被鄙視。他們是一群善良的傢夥，彼此互相關心並照料著他們的花園，而且他們也已經證明了自己在緊要關頭遠以看起來的要頑強許多。」

entries.name: 人類
entries: 「他們的野心、和在他們短暫生命逝去前完成某事的渴望，總是如此匆忙──他們的努力有時候看起來是如此徒勞。但接著當你看向他們所達成的一切，你也只能承認並讚嘆他們的成就。要是他們能放慢腳步，學些教養就更好了。」

entries.name: 探索與冒險
entries: 精靈們會因為旅行的慾望而踏上冒險。由於他們是如此長壽，他們往往得以享受數個世紀的探索和發現。他們並不喜歡人類社會那日復一日的死板、卻在數十年間不斷變化的生活步調，因此他們總是尋找著能讓他們自由旅行、並以自己步調進行的事業。精靈們同樣享受鍛鍊他們的武藝或學習更強大的魔法力量，而冒險生活恰能滿足這點。他們有些人可能會加入反抗強權壓迫的革命軍，而另一些人則可能會為了道德而戰。

entries.name: 精靈姓名
entries: 精靈們通常會在百歲生日後一段時間宣布自己成年，在這之前，他們都被視為孩童，且會被以乳名稱呼。

在宣布成年時，精靈會為自己選擇一個成年名字，但那些從小就認識他或她的人們可能會繼續使用乳名稱呼他們。每個成年精靈的名字都是獨一無二的，儘管它可能會反映著某個受人尊敬的個體或其他家族成員的名稱。男性和女性的名字之間並沒有什麼差異；而下述的分組僅僅反映著普遍的傾向。此外，每個精靈承擔著一個家族名，通常是由其他精靈詞彙組合而成。有些旅行於人類社會中的精靈會將他們的家族名翻譯成通用語，而其他精靈則會保留其精靈語的用法。

entries: Descended from an earlier subrace of dark skinned elves, the drow were banished from the surface world for following the goddess Lolth down the path to evil and corruption. Now they have built their own civilization in the depths of the Underdark, patterned after the Way of Lolth. Also called dark elves, the drow have black skin that resembles polished obsidian and stark white or pale yellow hair. They commonly have very pale eyes (so pale as to be mistaken for white) in shades of pale lilac, silver, pink, and blue. They tend to be smaller and thinner than most elves.

entries.name: The Darkness of the Drow
entries: Were it not for one renowned exception, the race of drow would be universally reviled. Their depraved society is preoccupied with the favor of Lolth, their spider-queen goddess, who sanctions murder and the extermination of entire families noble houses vie for position.
Yet one drow, at least, broke the mold. In the world of the Forgotten Realms, Drizzt Do'Urden, ranger of the North, has proven his quality as a good-hearted defender of the weak and innocent.

Drow grow up believing that surface dwelling races are worthless except as slaves. Drow who develop a conscience or find it necessary to cooperate with members of other races find it hard to overcome that prejudice, especially when they are so often on the receiving end of hatred.

Eladrin are elves native to the Feywild, a realm of beauty, unpredictable emotion, and boundless magic. An eladrin is associated with one of the four seasons and has coloration reminiscent of that season, which can also affect the eladrin's mood:

items.name: Autumn
items.entry: is the season of peace and goodwill, when summer's harvest is shared with all.

items.name: Winter
items.entry: is the season of contemplation and dolor, when the vibrant energy of the world slumbers.

items.name: Spring
items.entry: is the season of cheerfulness and celebration, marked by merriment as winter's sorrow passes.

items.name: Summer
items.entry: is the season of boldness and aggression, a time of unfettered energy.

entries: Some eladrin remain associated with a particular season for their entire lives, whereas other eladrin transform, adopting characteristics of a new season. When finishing a long rest, any eladrin can change their season. An eladrin might choose the season that is present in the world or perhaps the season that most closely matches the eladrin's current emotional state. For example, an eladrin might shift to autumn if filled with contentment, another eladrin could change to winter if plunged into sorrow, still another might be bursting with joy and become an eladrin of spring, and fury might cause an eladrin to change to summer.
The following tables offer personality suggestions for eladrin of each season. You can roll on the tables or use them as inspiration for characteristics of your own.

entries.caption: Autumn
rows: If someone is in need, you never withhold aid.
You share what you have, with little regard for your own needs.
There are no simple meals, only lavish feasts.
You stock up on fine food and drink. You hate going without such comforts.
You trust others without a second thought.
You give to others, to the point that you leave yourself without necessary supplies.
Everyone is your friend, or a potential friend.
You spend excessively on creature comforts.

entries.caption: Winter
rows: The worst case is the most likely to occur.
You preserve what you have. Better to be hungry today and have food for tomorrow.
Life is full of dangers, but you are ready for them.
A penny spent is a penny lost forever.
Everything dies eventually. Why bother building anything that is supposedly meant to last?
Nothing matters to you, and you allow others to guide your actions.
Your needs come first. In winter, all must watch out for themselves.
You speak only to point out the flaws in others' plans.

entries.caption: Spring
rows: Every day is the greatest day of your life.
You approach everything with enthusiasm, even the most mundane chores.
You love music and song. You supply a tune yourself if no one else can.
You can't stay still.
You overdrink.
Toil is for drudges. Yours should be a life of leisure.
A pretty face infatuates you in an instant, but your fancy passes with equal speed.
Anything worth doing is worth doing again and again.

entries.caption: Summer
rows: You believe that direct confrontation is the best way to solve problems.
Overwhelming force can accomplish almost anything. The tougher the problem, the more force you apply.
You stand tall and strong so that others can lean on you.
You maintain an intimidating front. It's better to prevent fights with a show of force than to harm others.
You are stubborn. Let others change.
The best option is one that is swift, unexpected, and overwhelming.
Punch first. Talk later.
Your fury can carry you through anything.

entries: As a high elf, you have a keen mind and a mastery of at least the basics of magic. In many of the worlds of D&D, there are two kinds of high elves. One type (which includes the gray elves and valley elves of Greyhawk, the Silvanesti of Dragonlance, and the sun elves of the Forgotten Realms) is haughty and reclusive, believing themselves to be superior to non-elves and even other elves. The other type (including the high elves of Greyhawk, the Qualinesti of Dragonlance, and the moon elves of the Forgotten Realms) are more common and more friendly, and often encountered among humans and other races.

The sun elves of Faerun (also called gold elves or sunrise elves) have bronze skin and hair of copper, black, or golden blond. Their eyes are golden, silver, or black. Moon elves (also called silver elves or gray elves) are much paler, with alabaster skin sometimes tinged with blue. They often have hair of silver-white, black, or blue, but various shades of blond, brown, and red are not uncommon. Their eyes are blue or green and flecked with gold.

做為一名高等精靈，你具有敏銳的心靈且精通至少一種基礎魔法。在D&D的許多世界中，存在著二種高等精靈。其中一種（包括了灰鷹世界的灰精靈(gray elf)和山穀精靈(valley elf)、龍槍世界的西瓦納斯提精靈(Silvanesti)、和被遺忘國度的日精靈(sun elf)）傲慢而孤僻，深信他們自己遠比非精靈或甚至其他精靈種族來的更加優越。另一種類型（包括灰鷹世界的高等精靈(high elf)、龍槍世界的奎靈納斯提精靈(Qualinesti)、和被遺忘國度的月精靈(moon elf)）則更常見且更為友善，並且經常能在人類和其他種族之中被見到。
費倫的日精靈（又被稱作金精靈或晨曦精靈）有著青銅色的肌膚，和赤銅、黑色、或金色的頭髮。他們的眼睛可能是金色、銀色、或黑色。月精靈（又被稱作銀精靈或灰精靈）則更為蒼白一些，有著如雪花石膏般，且有時淡染青藍的肌膚。他們通常有著銀白色、黑色、或藍色的秀髮，而不同深淺的金黃色、棕色和朱紅髮色也不算罕見。他們的雙眼是藍或綠色，並點綴著些許金色。

entries.items: The pallid elves are a mystical and insightful people with skin as pale as the surface of Exandria's largest moon. They emerged from the Pallid Grove this century and wander the world with childlike curiosity.

entries: Sea elves fell in love with the wild beauty of the ocean in the earliest days of the multiverse. While other elves traveled from realm to realm, the sea elves navigated the deepest currents and explored the waters across a hundred worlds. Today, they live in small, hidden communities in the ocean shallows and on the Elemental Plane of Water.

entries.name: Sahuagin: Danger from the Depths
entries: The sea elves face as many perils in their watery world as other elves face on dry land, but none are as deadly as the sahuagin. The animosity between these two races stems from the sahuagin's ferocious territoriality. They simply won't abide any other intelligent society, and they consider the entire sea to be their domain.

Adding to the tension, the sahuagin worship Sekolah, the shark god, while Deep Sashelas, the sea deity of the elves, is a sworn enemy of all sharks. But even if the sea elves inexplicably began worshiping Sekolah, the sahuagin still wouldn't be able to get along with them-in the grip of a blood frenzy, sahuagin will tear apart even others of their own kind!

Sworn to the Raven Queen's service, the mysterious shadar-kai venture into the Material Plane from the Shadowfell to advance her will. Once they were fey like the rest of their elven kin, and now they exist in a strange state between life and death. Eladrin and shadar-kai are like reflections of each other: one bursting with emotion, the other nearly devoid of it.

As a wood elf, you have keen senses and intuition, and your fleet feet carry you quickly and stealthily through your native forests. This category includes the wild elves (grugach) of Greyhawk and the Kagonesti of Dragonlance, as well as the races called wood elves in Greyhawk and the Forgotten Realms. In Faerun, wood elves (also called wild elves, green elves, or forest elves) are reclusive and distrusting of non-elves.

Wood elves' skin tends to be copperish in hue, sometimes with traces of green. Their hair tends toward browns and blacks, but it is occasionally blond or copper-colored. Their eyes are green, brown, or hazel.
做為一名木精靈，你具有敏銳的感官和直覺，且你迅捷的步伐讓你得以快速而隱密的穿梭在你熟悉的森林中。這個分類包括了灰鷹世界的野精靈(wild elf)（又被稱作革魯哈祈(grugach)）、龍槍世界的卡貢納斯提精靈(Kagonesti)、以及在灰鷹世界和被遺忘國度中被稱作木精靈(wood elf)的種族。在費倫，木精靈（又被稱作野精靈、綠精靈、或森精靈）離群索居，且並不信任非精靈種族。
木精靈的肌膚傾向赤銅色調，有時會帶有點蒼綠。他們的頭髮偏向棕色和黑色，但偶爾也會出現金黃色或赤銅色系。他們的眼睛呈現綠色、棕色、或淡褐色。

Elves are a fearless and adaptable people. They have fared better than most in the tumultuous environment of Zendikar, and many have reacted to the reappearance of the Eldrazi with resilience and courage. They remain the most prevalent race on Murasa, and have a strong presence in other regions as well. Their treetop villages seem to regrow almost as soon as they are destroyed—much like the Murasan jungles where they are found.

Elves are strongly associated with green mana, the magic that flows through their forest homes. Their shamans and druids channel this magic of life and growth, communing with the land or the spirits of the departed. Striving to live in harmony with nature, they celebrate the ties between their communities and their connection with the broader world around them.

entries.name: Wildly Elegant
entries: Elves are about as tall as humans, but are more slender. Their legs are long, and their pointed ears sweep back from their heads. They move gracefully and hold themselves with elegant poise, but they are a people of the woodlands, and their life in the wilds is manifested in the practical simplicity of their clothes and equipment. Never ones to waste anything that can be reused, elves stitch torn garments together into new ones, and transform broken sword blades into useful gear. They prefer leather for protection rather than metal, which they use to craft swords, spears, arrowheads, and climbing hooks.

The elves of the imperious Joraga nation of Bala Ged have little respect for any other race of Zendikar—or even for other elves. The survival of their nation and its traditions is the Joraga elves' only goal, and they view the influence of others as a weakness. The Joraga eschew the goods and habits of others, even avoiding the pathways blazed by the Tajuru when possible. Many view the nomadic Joraga clans as little more than bands of roving murderers, but a complex culture hides behind those clans' aggressive exterior.

Elves of the Mul Daya nation of Bala Ged are set apart from other elves by their relationship with the spirits of their elven ancestors. To the Mul Daya, the spirit world and the mortal realm are different only in terms of their tangibility. Death and the spirits of the dead are as much a part of the lives of the Mul Daya as is the natural world. This is not a macabre sentiment to the elves; they simply view it as the truest sense of the natural order.

Mul Daya elves can often be recognized by their face painting and tattooing. Many Mul Daya decorate their skins with an enwrapping vine motif, and make use of poisons and acids collected at great cost from strange creatures and plants in the depths of Kazandu.

The Tajuru nation is the largest of the three main elven nations, concentrated in Murasa and spread across  other parts of Zendikar as hundreds of far-flung clans. Tajuru elves are the most open to people of other races, seeing their skills and perspectives as valuable new tools for survival. The Tajuru are also more open to new lifestyles, be it living in a mountaintop citadel or roaming grassy plains.

Firbolg tribes cloister in remote forest strongholds, preferring to spend their days in quiet harmony with the woods. When provoked, firbolgs demonstrate formidable skills with weapons and druidic magic.

entries.name: Humble Guardians
entries: Firbolgs love nothing more than a peaceful day spent among the trees of an old forest. They see forests as sacred places, representing the heart of the world and monuments to the durability of life.

In their role as caretakers, firbolgs live off the land while striving to remain in balance with nature. Their methods reflect common sense and remarkable resourcefulness. During a bountiful summer, they store away excess nuts, fruit, and berries. When winter arrives, they scatter everything they can spare to ensure the animals of the wood survive until springtime.

In a firbolg's eyes, there is no greater fault than greed. The firbolgs believe that the world remains healthiest when each creature takes only what it needs. Material goods, especially precious gems and gold, have little appeal to them. What use are such things when winter lingers and food runs short?

entries.name: Natural Druids
entries: Firbolgs have a talent for druidic magic. Their cultural reverence for nature, combined with their strong and insightful minds, makes learning such magic an instinctive part of their development. Almost every firbolg learns a few spells, typically those used to mask their presence, and many go on to master nature magic.

Firbolgs who become druids serve as stronghold leaders. With every action the tribe takes, the druids weigh not only the group's needs, but the effect each action will have on the forest and the rest of the natural world. Firbolg tribes would rather go hungry than strain the land during a famine.

entries.name: Firbolg Classes
entries: Most firbolgs are druids, rangers, or fighters. Among their kind, these vocations are passed down from one generation to the next. The firbolgs' magical heritage also expresses itself in other ways; those who become bards preserve the clan's lore, and firbolg sorcerers defend their communities. Firbolg wizards arise when a clan becomes friendly with elves.
Firbolg rogues are typically scouts tasked with spying on neighboring folk to determine their intentions. They are most common among firbolgs whose homes border human settlements.
Firbolg barbarians are rare except among clans that face constant threats from evil humanoids and other invaders.
Firbolg clerics and paladins are usually dedicated to nature gods and are seen as enforcers of that god's will.
Firbolg warlocks are rare, but some clans forge alliances and arcane pacts with powerful fey beings.
Firbolg monks are almost entirely unheard of, though a monastery might take in the young survivors of a devastated firbolg clan.

entries.name: Hidden Shepherds
entries: As caretakers of the land, firbolgs prefer to remain out of sight and out of mind. They don't try to dominate nature, but rather seek to ensure that it prospers and survives according to its own laws.

Firbolgs use their magic to keep their presence in a forest secret. This approach allows them to avoid the politics and struggles of elves, humans, and orcs. Such events concern the firbolgs only when the events affect the forest.

Even in the face of an intrusion, firbolgs prefer a subtle, gentle approach to prevent damage to their territory. They employ their magic to make the forest an unappealing place to explore by temporarily diverting springs, driving away game, stealing critical tools, and altering trails to leave hunting or lumber parties hopelessly lost. The firbolgs' presence is marked by an absence of animals and a strange quiet, as if the forest wishes to avoid attracting attention to itself. The faster travelers decide to move on, the better.

If these tactics fail, the firbolgs take more direct action. Their observations of a settlement determine what happens next. If the outsiders seem peaceful, the firbolgs approach and gently ask them to leave, even offering food and other supplies to aid their departure. If those who insist on remaining respect nature, take only what they need, and live in harmony with the wood, firbolgs explore the possibility of friendship with them, as long as the outsiders vow to safeguard the forest. If the settlers clearly display evil intentions, however, the firbolgs martial their strength and magic for a single overwhelming attack.

entries.name: Outcast Adventurers
entries: As guardians of the wood, few firbolgs would dream of leaving their homes or attempting to fit into human society. An exiled firbolg, or one whose clan has been destroyed, might not have a choice in the matter. Most adventuring firbolgs fall into this latter category.

Outcast firbolgs can never return home. They committed some unforgivable deed, usually something that put their homeland at risk, such as starting a forest fire or killing a rare or beautiful wild creature. These firbolgs are loners who wander the world in hope of finding a new place to call home.
Orphaned firbolgs are those whose clans or home lands have been destroyed. They become crusaders for nature, seeking to avenge their loss and prevent the further destruction of the natural world.

A few rare firbolgs are entrusted by their clan with an important mission that takes them beyond their homes. These firbolgs feel like pilgrims in a strange land, and usually they wish only to complete their quests and return home as quickly as possible.
The Firbolg Adventurers table can serve as inspiration for determining why a firbolg character leaves home.

entries.caption: Firbolg Adventurers
rows: Outcast for murder
Outcast for severely damaging home territory
Clan slain by invading humanoids
Clan slain by a dragon or demon
Separated from the tribe and lost
Homeland destroyed by natural disaster
Personal quest ordained by omens
Dispatched on a quest by tribe leaders

entries.name: Firbolg Names
entries: Firbolg adopt elven names when they must deal with outsiders, although the concept of names strikes them as strange. They know the animals and plants of the forest without formal names, and instead identify the forest's children by their deeds, habits, and other actions.

By the same token, their tribe names merely refer to their homes. When dealing with other races, firbolgs refer to their lands by whatever name the surrounding folk use, as a matter of tact and hospitality, but among their own kind they simply call it "home." Sometimes firbolgs adopt the nicknames or titles outsiders give them under the assumption that those who need names can call them whatever they wish.
在談及其他位面時，大多數人都會將認為它們是個遙遠不可及的神祕國度，但事實上，在世界各處都留有這些位面的影響。這種影響有時候甚至會體現在那些意外降生，血液中流著位面之力的人們身上。元素裔，巨靈和凡人的後裔，便是這類人之一。
諸元素位面的環境對原生於物質位面的生物經常不怎麼友善：輾壓土層、灼熱火燄、無盡天空、和無盡之海，即使只是短暫停留，這些險惡環境仍使造訪元素位面帶來極大的危險。然而，那些強大的巨靈在踏入凡間時，就無須面對這樣的麻煩。祂們能輕易適應於物質位面的相混元素，且他們有時也會主動、或被魔法強迫而前來造訪物質位面。有些巨靈甚至會偽裝成凡人的樣貌，並化名以旅行其中。
在他們的造訪期間，巨靈可能會看上某個凡人，他們結為好友、發展浪漫，並有時因此生下孩子。他們的孩子即為元素裔：聯繫於兩個世界，卻又不屬於任何一方的個體。有些元素裔會誕生在凡人和巨靈結合的家庭中，其他則大多會有兩名巨靈做為雙親，而少數元素裔的家族中則會有一名身為巨靈的遙遠先祖，並在沉睡了數個世代之後才展現出其體內的元素血脈。
偶爾，暴露在元素力量的湧流中，例如內層位面或位面交匯處能量噴湧所產生的現象，也可能會導致元素裔的誕生。該區域內生物體內所飽含的元素能量可能會足以改變他們的本質，並使他們與其他凡人結合所生的子嗣成為元素裔。

entries.name: 元素力量的繼承者
entries: 元素裔從其雙重本質中各繼承了一些性質。他們長的與人類相似，但有著不同尋常的膚色（紅色、綠色、藍色、或灰色），且身上還會出現一些奇異的特徵。他們體內流淌的元素之血在每個元素裔身上都各自體現出不同的性質，且經常以魔法力量的方式呈現。
從外型輪廓來看，元素裔通常會被當作人類。那些繼承了土或水元素的元素裔通常較為沉重，而氣和火元素裔則較輕。每個元素裔都可能保有一些讓人能聯想到其凡人父母的特徵（像是精靈的尖耳朵、矮人的健壯骨架和濃密毛髮、半身人的小巧手腳、地侏的大眼睛，諸如此類）。
元素裔幾乎從未與他們的元素親族有所聯繫。巨靈很少對於他們的凡人子嗣感興趣，且僅僅將他們視為一場意外。他們許多甚至對他們的元素裔子女不帶任何感情。
有些元素裔會因為他們獨特的外觀和奇異魔法而被驅逐，做為放逐者浪蕩四方、或成為蠻荒之地那些類人蠻族和詭異邪教的領袖。其他元素裔則可能獲得地位和極大的影響力，尤其是在那些元素生物備受尊崇的場所更是如此。而少數元素裔則會離開物質位面以尋找他們巨靈親族的庇護。

entries.name: 狂野而自信
entries: 元素裔鮮少缺乏自信心，他們認為自己能夠應對其道路上幾乎所有的挑戰。這種確定性在某個元素裔身上可能會被表現成優雅自信、而在另一人身上則可能體現為傲慢自大。這類似信心有時會使元素裔對風險視而不見，且他們的「偉大計畫」也經常會使他們和其他人陷入麻煩。
太多次失敗的經歷可能會削弱元素裔原本的過甚意識，因此他們會不斷鞭策自己改進，磨練天賦並完善他們的技藝。

entries.name: 元素裔的家園
entries: 做為稀有生物，元素裔可能會終其一生而從未遇到另一名同族。元素裔並沒有自己的大城市或帝國。他們甚至很少有自己的群體，且通常會接受他們出生地的文化和社會。他們的長相越奇特，他們所經歷的日子也就越艱困。許多元素裔會迷失沉醉在熙來攘往的大城市中，在這習慣於形形色色人們的地方，他們的與眾不同鮮少會引來不必要的註意。
然而，那些生活在邊境的元素裔們則過得更加艱難。那裡的人們往往不太願意接納異類。有時候，冷淡的態度和懷疑的目光就是元素裔所能期望得到的最好待遇；在更落後的地方，他們得面對排斥放逐、或甚至承受那些將其誤認為邪魔的人們的暴力對待。面對這樣的艱困生活，這些元素裔往往選擇離群於荒野之中，以群山、森林、湖畔或地下為家。
在被遺忘的國度，大部分的氣和火元素裔都是那些曾經統治過卡林杉(Calimshan)的氣巨靈和火巨靈的後裔。當這些統治者被推翻時，他們的子孫也隨之四散。在數千年以後，這些元素裔的血脈已經散佈在各地。儘管相當少見，但在費倫的西部沿著卡林杉北岸一路延伸至劍灣，以及向東到西土(Western Heartlands)的區域，會較容易發現到氣和火元素裔的蹤跡。其中有些則選擇留在他們遠古的家園。
相反的，水和地元素裔則沒有類似的共同歷史。他們每個人的血統淵源都難以追溯，且有時其遺傳還會跨一兩代才會顯現。許多地元素裔起源自北地，並從該處散布開來。水元素裔則來自沿岸地區，其中最大的一群則來自於墜星海(Sea of Fallen Stars)的周邊地區。
在札卡拉(Zakhara)，那個對大多數費倫居民而言僅僅存在於傳說的遙遠國度，巨靈和施法者會彼此往來，且元素裔也可能會因此誕生。在這片土地的歷史長河中，這些元素裔一直都是巨大災厄和祝福的源頭。

entries.name: 元素裔名字
entries: 元素裔使用將其扶養長大的族群的命名習慣。他們可能往後才會用與眾不同的名字以彰顯自己的傳承血脈，像是列燄(Flame)、餘燼(Ember)、波濤(Wave)、或瑪瑙(Onyx)。
As an air genasi, you are descended from the djinn. As changeable as the weather, your moods shift from calm to wild and violent with little warning, but these storms rarely last long.

Air genasi typically have light blue skin, hair, and eyes. A faint but constant breeze accompanies them, tousling the hair and stirring the clothing. Some air genasi speak with breathy voices, marked by a faint echo. A few display odd patterns in their flesh or grow crystals from their scalps.
做為一名氣元素裔，你是氣巨靈的後裔。和天氣一樣多變，你的情緒會幾乎毫無徵兆地從平靜轉變為狂野和暴力，但這種情緒風暴鮮少持續太長的時間。
氣元素裔通常具有亮藍色的肌膚、頭髮、和雙眼。一陣微弱但持續不斷的微風伴隨著他們，吹拂他們的秀髮和衣衫。有些氣元素裔的話語帶有呼吸聲，並有著糢糊的回音。少部分的人則會有古怪的紋路浮現在他們的身體上，或從他們的頭皮長出晶體。

As an earth genasi, you are descended from the cruel and greedy dao, though you are not necessarily evil. You have inherited some measure of control over earth, reveling in superior strength and solid power. You tend to avoid rash decisions, pausing long enough to consider your options before taking action.

Elemental earth manifests differently from one individual to the next. Some earth genasi always have bits of dust falling from their bodies and mud clinging to their clothes, never getting clean no matter how often they bathe. Others are as shiny and polished as gemstones, with skin tones of deep brown or black, eyes sparkling like agates. Earth genasi can also have smooth metallic flesh, dull iron skin spotted with rust, a pebbled and rough hide, or even a coating of tiny embedded crystals. The most arresting have fissures in their flesh, from which faint light shines.
做為一名土元素裔，你是那殘忍而貪婪的土巨靈的後裔，但你不一定因此繼承了其邪惡的天性。你在一定程度上繼承了他們支配大地的能力，並陶醉於出眾而堅實的力量。你傾向避免魯莽的決定，在貿然行動前躊躇許久，三思後行。
土元素在每名個體身上所體現出的性質各有不同。有些土元素裔的身上總會落下點點塵土，汙泥沾染著他們的衣服，無論他們多常清洗都仍顯得骯髒。其他元素裔可能有著如寶石般散發光澤的深棕色或黑色肌膚，雙眼則如同瑪瑙般閃燿。土元素裔也可能會有著光滑如金屬般的肉體、點綴著鏽斑的黯淡鋼鐵肌膚、滿布卵石的粗糙皮質、或甚至是被一層微小晶體給覆蓋。其中最引人註目的特徵是分布在他們身軀上，從中透出微弱光芒的裂紋，

As a fire genasi, you have inherited the volatile mood and keen mind of the efreet. You tend toward impatience and making snap judgments. Rather than hide your distinctive appearance, you exult in it.

Nearly all fire genasi are feverishly hot as if burning inside, an impression reinforced by flaming red, coal-black, or ash-gray skin tones. The more human-looking have fiery red hair that writhes under extreme emotion, while more exotic specimens sport actual flames dancing on their heads. Fire genasi voices might sound like crackling flames, and their eyes flare when angered. Some are accompanied by the faint scent of brimstone.
做為一名火元素裔，你繼承了火巨靈那反覆無常的性情和敏銳的頭腦。你容易不耐煩並立刻做出決斷。你為自己那與眾不同的外貌而欣喜，而不會將之隱藏起來。
幾乎所有的火元素裔都彷彿內心熊熊燃燒一般熾熱如火，而這印象更因為他們那火紅、碳黑、或淺灰的膚色被更進一步強化。一些外貌與人類較相似的個體有著一頭火紅的頭髮，並會在情緒激動時翻騰扭動；而另一些更奇特個體的頭頂上則舞動著真正的火燄。火元素裔的聲音可能聽起來像是火燄劈啪聲，且他們的雙眼會在憤怒時如燃燒般閃燿。有些火元素裔的身上會伴隨著淡淡的硫磺氣味。

The lapping of waves, the spray of sea foam on the wind, the ocean depths, all of these things call to your heart. You wander freely and take pride in your independence, though others might consider you selfish.

Most water genasi look as if they just finished bathing, with beads of moisture collecting on their skin and hair. They smell of fresh rain and clean water. Blue or green skin is common, and most have somewhat overlarge eyes, blue-black in color. A water genasi's hair might float freely, swaying and waving as if underwater. Some have voices with undertones reminiscent of whale song or trickling streams.
陣陣浪潮，在風中飛濺的浪花泡沫、以及那海洋深淵之處，這一切的一切都在呼喚著你的心靈。你自由自在，為自己的獨立而備感自豪，儘管其他人可能會因此認為你表現自私。
大部分的水元素裔看起來就彷彿他們剛出浴一般，肌膚和頭髮上總是上滿布水珠，散發著新雨和清水的味道。他們通常有著藍色或綠色的肌膚，且大多有著一雙略大的眼睛，帶有藍黑色的瞳色。水元素裔的頭髮可能會如同在水中一樣隨意飄盪、搖擺自如。有些水元素裔的聲音會帶有讓人想起鯨魚之歌或涓涓細流的低音聲線。
The brutal githyanki are trained from birth as warriors.
In their fortresses within Limbo, the githzerai hone their minds to a razor's edge.
在地侏們緊密相連的聚落中，忙碌工作時發出的哼唱聲總是迴盪在壅擠的住宅和周遭環境。而更吵鬧的聲響則時不時打斷這些哼唱：齒輪嘎吱作響的研磨聲、輕微的爆炸聲、因驚喜或驚訝而發出的叫喊、以及忽然爆出的大笑聲，各式各樣的聲音此起彼落、交織在一起。地侏們熱愛生命，且總是享受著發明、探索、調查、創造、和玩樂的每分每刻。

entries.name: 活潑表現
entries: 地侏的生活熱情和精力奔流於他或她那嬌小身軀的每一吋中。地侏的平均身高略高於3呎，重約40到45磅。他們棕黃或褐色的臉龐常常掛著燦爛的笑容（就在他們那巨大鼻子的正下方），他們明亮的眼睛總閃爍著興奮的光芒。他們美麗的頭髮向著幾乎所有方向生長，就像是在表現地侏那種對周遭事物永不滿足的興趣一般。
地侏的個性大大體現在他們的外觀上。男性地侏的鬍子，相比他們那狂野的頭髮，總是被細心打理，但也經常被做出如古怪分岔或整齊鬚端的款式。地侏的服裝，盡管通常呈現溫和的泥土色調，但卻精心裝飾著刺繡、壓花、或是閃亮的珠寶。

entries.name: 熱衷喜悅
entries: 對地侏而言，活著是一件美妙的事，且他們會從那長達三到五個世紀的人生中榨取每一分快樂。人類可能會在這麼冗長的生命中感到厭倦，精靈則可能會在他們生命的長河中花費大量時間品嘗世間的美，而儘管有那麼多的時間，地侏卻似乎仍會擔心他們沒有足夠的時間去見識或完成他們想要的一切。
地侏在說話時，總像是無法很快地把腦中的思緒給表達出來。即使他們要對一系列話題提出想法和建議時，他們仍會先仔細傾聽他人的想法，並在過程中適當地加入驚訝或讚賞的叫喊。
儘管地侏熱愛是雙關語和惡作劇等各樣笑話，他們也同樣專註於從事更加認真嚴肅的事情。許多地侏是經驗豐富的工程師、煉金術士、修補匠、和發明家。在完善自己工作的過程中，他們勇於犯錯，以此自嘲，並敢於冒險（有時近乎魯莽）和追求更大的夢想。

entries.name: 明亮地穴
entries: 地侏們會在崎嶇丘陵、或林木繁盛的地帶建立他們的家園。他們生活在地下，但卻擁有比矮人更清新的空氣，並可以隨時享受地表上那自然、生意盎然的世界。他們的家園被巧妙的隱密在精巧建築設計和簡單幻術之後。受邀請的訪客會被迅速地招待到那明亮而溫暖的地洞中。而那些不速之客則很難在第一時間發現這些地洞的存在。
居住在人類國家中的地侏們通常會是寶石切割師、工程師、學者、或修補匠。有些人類家庭會僱用地侏做為家庭教師，確保其子女能像地侏一樣在認真學習的同時享受快樂。一名地侏在他漫長的壽命中，可能會持續在一個人類家族中擔當好幾個世代的家庭教師。

entries.name: 放眼世界
entries: 地侏好奇而衝動，他們可能會為了見識這個世界、或為了滿足探索的熱愛而踏上冒險的旅途。做為寶石和其他精緻事物的愛好者，有些地侏會將冒險視為一個儘管危險，但卻能快速獲得財富的捷徑。無論促使他們踏上冒險的原因如何，適應於這種生活方式的地侏們所能獲得的樂趣就跟他們從事任何其他活動所能獲得的一樣多，而這有時也會給他們的冒險同伴造成很大的困擾。

entries.name: 地侏姓名
entries: 地侏們喜歡取名字，且他們大部分都擁有半打左右的名字。一名地侏的母親、父親、氏族長老和叔叔阿姨都會為他各取一個名字，而各種幾乎每個人所取的暱稱則可能也可能不會著時間的推移而保留下來。地侏的名字往往是從其祖先或遠親的名字稍作改變而來，但其中也有些是完全新創的名字。當與人類和其他對於取名較為「保守」的種族打交道時，地侏早已學會使用不超過三種名字與之交流：本名，氏族名，和一個暱稱，並從他們這三種類別的各種名字中各挑一個聽起來最有趣的名字使用。

entries.name: 地底地侏
entries: 地侏的第三個亞種，地底地侏（或稱斯奈布力(svirfneblin)）以小聚落散居在幽暗地獄之中。跟灰矮人和卓爾精靈不同，斯奈布力就跟他們在地表的表親一樣善良。然而，他們的幽默感和熱情仍因那壓抑環境的影響而被抑制，且他們的創新專業則大多轉為表現在石藝領域上。

Forest gnomes and rock gnomes are the gnomes most commonly encountered in the lands of the surface world. There is another subrace of gnomes rarely seen by any surface-dweller: deep gnomes, also known as svirfneblin. Guarded, and suspicious of outsiders, svirfneblin are cunning and taciturn, but can be just as kind-hearted, loyal, and compassionate as their surface cousins.

entries.name: Born of Deep Earth
entries: Svirfneblin seem more like creatures of stone than flesh. Their leathery skin is usually a gray, brown, or dun hue that acts as a natural camouflage with the rock around them. Their bodies are gnarled with hard muscle or fat, and they are heavier than their small stature suggests; svirfneblin often weigh 100 pounds or more but rarely stand much more than 3 feet tall.

Male svirfneblin are bald from early childhood, although adults can grow stiff beards or mustaches. Females have full heads of hair, and they usually tie their hair back in braids or cut it short to keep it from getting in their way as they work.

Svirfneblin are well adapted for their subterranean existence. They have excellent darkvision, and many of them have magical talents that rival the innate spellcasting of the drow and duergar. They are surprisingly strong for their size, enduring toil and danger that would overwhelm most other people.

entries.name: Master Miners
entries: Despite their guarded natures, svirfneblin aren't joyless. They admire skillful work and delicate craftsmanship, just like any other gnome. Svirfneblin love gemstones of all kinds, and they boldly seek out precious stones in the deepest and darkest tunnels. They are also expert gemcutters and miners, and they prize rubies above all other gemstones.

entries.name: Deep Dwellers
entries: Svirfneblin are known as deep gnomes because they choose to live far below the earth's surface. Most svirfneblin never see the light of day. Their homes are well-hidden strongholds concealed by mazelike passages and clever illusions. Vast networks of mine tunnels ring most svirfneblin settlements, guarded by deadly traps and concealed sentries. Once a traveler passes through the outer defenses, the tunnels open up into marvelous cavern-towns carved from the surrounding rock with exquisite care. The svirfneblin are austere in their comforts compared to their surface cousins, but they take great pride in their stonework.

Deep gnomes do their best to remain hidden. Even if surface travelers succeed in locating a svirfneblin community, winning their trust can be even more difficult. Those rare travelers who do succeed in befriending deep gnomes find that they are loyal and courageous allies against any foe.

entries.name: Scouts and Spies
entries: Surface-dwelling gnomes often take up the adventurer's life out of sheer curiosity about the world around them, eager to see new things and meet new people.
By comparison, most svirfneblin possess very little wanderlust and rarely travel far from home. They see the surface world as a bewildering place without boundaries and filled with unknown dangers.

Nevertheless, a few svirfneblin understand that it is necessary to know something about what is happening on the surface near their hidden refuges. As a result, some svirfneblin become scouts, spies, or messengers who venture abroad, doing their best to avoid attention.
These travelers are notoriously close-mouthed about where they come from and what they are up to, but a few eventually learn to trust good-hearted people of the surface world.

A few svirfneblin become merchants who deal with other races both above and below ground. Drow, duergar, and other peoples know that svirfneblin are usually neutral in outlook and typically honest in their dealings. Serving as middlemen between races too hostile to deal with each other directly can be lucrative, and it serves an important defensive function; svirfneblin middlemen tend to know more about rumors and threats between rival merchants than anybody else.

entries.name: Deep Gnome Names
entries: Svirfneblin prefer less flamboyant names than their rock gnome or forest gnome cousins. Clan names reflect skills or occupations that a particular family is associated with, and sometimes change if a noteworthy individual strikes out in a new direction.

entries.name: Deep Gnomes in the Forgotten Realms
entries: In the Forgotten Realms, deep gnomes live within a perilous, subterranean world known as the Underdark. This maze of caverns and tunnels is home to some of the most feared creatures in Faerûn. Because of this, the svirfneblin that dwell here are much more distrusting and wary than their kin on other worlds. Rarely do they allow strangers within their midst, and those that they must deal with are kept at arms length. If one is lucky enough to be trusted by the deep gnomes, they are a friend for life. For the svirfneblin of the Underdark, genuine trust is a commodity far more valuable than gold.
林地侏和岩地侏是地表世界中最常見的地侏種族。然而，還有另一種地表居民很少遭遇到的地侏亞種：地底地侏，也被稱做斯奈布力(svirfneblin)。狡黠寡言的斯奈布力一族對外來者總是謹慎而多疑，但他們也跟其地表上的親族一樣善良、忠誠、且充滿同情心。

entries.name: 生於深地
entries: 斯奈布力看起來更像是石頭構成的生物，而非血肉之軀。他們粗糙的皮膚通常是灰色、棕色、或暗褐色，並藉此做為融入他們周遭岩地的天然保護色。他們的身體因結實的肌肉和脂肪而顯得粗腫，且他們比其矮小身形看起來要來得更重；斯奈布力通常重達100磅或以上，但身高很少超過3呎高。
男性斯奈布力從孩童時便禿頂無髮，但在成年後可能會長出硬挺的鬍鬚。女性長有一頭濃密的秀髮，且她們經常將她們的頭髮綁成辮子或剪短，以避免其影響她們工作。
斯奈布力相當適應了他們地底的生活。他們具有出色的黑暗視覺，且他們之中許多人都具有可以媲美卓爾精靈和灰矮人的魔法天賦。他們體型雖小卻異常強壯，能夠承受住足以壓垮大多數人的苦工和危險。

entries.name: 礦工大師
entries: 儘管他們天性謹慎，斯奈布力並不無趣。他們就像任何其他地侏一樣欣賞熟練的做工和精緻的工藝。斯奈布力熱愛各式各樣的寶石，甚至會大膽地在最深最暗的地道中尋找珍貴的寶石。他們同時也是專業的寶石切割工和礦工，且在所有寶石中尤其對紅寶石情有獨鍾。

entries.name: 地底棲居者
entries: 斯奈布力之所以被稱做地底地侏，正是因為他們選擇生活在遠離地表的深地。大部分的斯奈布力從未見過白日的光亮。他們的家園是隱蔽的要塞，隱藏在迷宮般的通道和巧妙的幻象之中。龐大的礦道網路環繞著斯奈布力的聚落，並且由致命陷阱和隱蔽的哨兵把守。一旦穿過他們的外圍防禦工事，旅行者將會發現其隧道豁然開朗，通往一座由周圍岩石精心彫刻而成的奇妙洞窟城市。與他們的地表親族相比，斯奈布力眼中的舒適要樸素許多，而他們仍為自己的石匠工藝倍感自豪。
地底地侏會盡其所能的保持隱密。即使地表的旅行者成功找到了斯奈布力的聚落，要贏得他們的信任卻是難上加難。而在罕見的情況下，那些成功與地底地侏締結友誼的旅行者們將會發現，在面對任何敵人時，他們都將是最忠實也最勇敢的盟友。

entries.name: 斥候與密探
entries: 居住在地表的地侏們經常因為對於這個世界的純粹好奇心而踏上冒險生活，渴求見識到更多新事物並結識新朋友。
相較之下，大部分的斯奈布力就沒有這種遊蕩四方的慾望，且鮮少遠離他們的家園。他們覺得地表世界是個令人混亂的場所，無邊無際，且充滿未知的危險。
儘管如此，仍有少數斯奈布力知道，掌握在接近他們隱密居所的地表世界上所發生的事情仍有其必要性。也因此，有些斯奈布力會成為斥候、密探、或信使，大膽的外出探險，並盡可能避免引起註意。
眾所周知，這些旅行者對於他們的來歷和目的去向總是絕口不提，但也有少數個體逐漸學會信任那些地表世界的好心人。
少數的斯奈布力成為了商人，與那些地表和地底的其他種族貿易往來。卓爾精靈、灰矮人、和其他種族都知道，斯奈布力通常會保持中立的觀點，且在交易中秉持誠信。在兩個彼此劍拔弩張的敵對種族之間，擔當中間人以間接經營兩者之間的貿易往來是個有利可圖的差事，且他們的身分也能做為重要的防禦機制：斯奈布力的中間人通常比任何人都更清楚關於敵對商貿對象之間流傳的謠言和威脅。

entries.name: 地底地侏姓名
entries: 與他們林地侏和岩地侏的表親相比，斯奈布力更喜歡不那麼花俏的名字。他們的氏族名反映了與特定家族關聯的技能或職業，且有時會因為某個重要人士帶領其向新方向發展而做出改變。

entries.name: 被遺忘國度中的地底地侏
entries: 在被遺忘的國度，地底地侏生活在名為幽暗地域的危險地下世界中。這裡迷宮般的洞窟和地道是費倫中那些最為駭人生物的家鄉。因為這個原因，居住在這裡的斯奈布力比他們在其他世界的同族要來得更為謹慎多疑。他們很少允許陌生人加入他們的圈子，且會與那些他們必須與之打交道的人們保持距離。若有人能夠有幸得到一名地底地侏的信賴，那他們將會是一輩子的朋友。對於幽暗地域的斯奈布力而言，真誠信賴的價值遠比黃金要來得貴重許多。

As a forest gnome, you have a natural knack for illusion and inherent quickness and stealth. In the worlds of D&D, forest gnomes are rare and secretive. They gather in hidden communities in sylvan forests, using illusions and trickery to conceal themselves from threats or to mask their escape should they be detected. Forest gnomes tend to be friendly with other good-spirited woodland folk, and they regard elves and good fey as their most important allies. These gnomes also befriend small forest animals and rely on them for information about threats that might prowl their lands.
做為一名林地侏，你天生具有使用幻術的本領，以及與生俱來的機敏和隱匿天賦。在D&D的世界中，林地侏非常稀少且行蹤隱匿。他們在偏僻森林中的隱密聚落中，使用幻術和詭計以使自己躲避威脅、或在他們被發現時用以從中逃脫。林地侏傾向與其他心地善良的林地住民友善相處，且他們將精靈和善良精類生物視為他們最重要的盟友。這些地侏同樣受到森林中小型動物的喜愛，並依靠牠們提供的情報以發覺那徘徊在他們領地上的威脅。
As a rock gnome, you have a natural inventiveness and hardiness beyond that of other gnomes. Most gnomes in the worlds of D&D are rock gnomes, including the tinker gnomes of the Dragonlance setting.
做為一名岩地侏，你天生具有超越其他地侏的創造天賦與耐性。大部分D&D世界中的地侏都是岩地侏，包括龍槍設定中的修匠地侏(tinker gnomes)。

Whether sniveling in fear, cackling with mad laughter, or snarling in a fury, goblins are wretched and inconsequential—at least in the eyes of most of Ravnica's other folk. In their own minds, though, they are content to lurk in the shadows only until they fully come into their own and receive the recognition they believe they deserve. They are entitled to some credit for their tenacity, agility, crafty ingenuity, and dumb luck, all of which has enabled them to survive in a world overrun with creatures larger and more powerful than they are.

entries.name: Small and Wiry
entries: Standing around 3 feet tall and covered in warty green or red skin, goblins have huge noses and ears. Their wiry bodies are surprisingly strong, and their mouths are full of sharp, crooked teeth.

Most goblins are bald, either by heredity or by choice, but a few boast shocks of red or black hair. Their arms and legs are elongated in proportion to their small bodies, and their fingers and toes are also long and slender. Many goblins prefer to go unshod to leave their toes exposed for climbing.

entries.name: Unfettered Emotion
entries: Creatures of raw impulse, goblins are found among guilds that value that quality, particularly the Izzet (where they typically serve as attendants for researchers), the Gruul (in camps that form hapless buffers between the clans and civilized regions), the Rakdos (putting their love of explosions to good use), and occasionally the Boros (if they discover a well of discipline and courage within themselves, or find themselves unable to resist the shininess of Boros weapons and armor). Many goblins are guildless and make their way as members of street gangs.

Sometimes driven by wild mood swings, goblins have an inclination toward destruction, which can take a playful form but is often anything but. Some goblins clobber things, others like to light them on fire, and many love to blow things up.

Goblins have an outrageous sense of humor, usually expressed through mischievous pranks. The malicious among them find pleasure in the misfortune of others and tend to cackle maniacally whenever they're amused. They can act with apparent randomness, sometimes just to confuse and befuddle others.

entries.name: Goblin Names
entries: The Goblin language is fond of certain sounds, and goblin names tend to repeat those sounds to form what can sound like nonsense words. A goblin's name gives no indication of gender.

entries: Ahh the Dankwood goblins! I have adventured far and wide in my time and never have I met such unique and interesting goblins as these. Perhaps it is the magical nature of the Dankwood itself as this forest was once rumored to have been the ancient sanctum of a powerful Netherese wizard, but who is to say? This world is a wondrous one and everywhere you go, something new is there to dazzle and amaze!
Dankwood goblins are much like any other run-of-the-mill goblin but they are much more gentle and artistic than the savage and uncouth goblins of the world.

They are inquisitive and have a magical bond with the small forest creatures with which they are often friends. They are fast and nimble and love to explore. Because of this they make great adventurers and guides.

Goblins are an inquisitive and adaptable race hampered by their small size, their natural cowardice, and a severe shortage of common sense. They eagerly explore areas that others hesitate to enter, and obsessively fiddle with magic that more sensible folk would take careful precautions with. They prize ancient artifacts not for their inherent value, but primarily as a mark of status—for a precious trophy proves that its owner survived a delve into a deep and dangerous ruin.

Goblins are associated with red mana. Their shamans are fond of spells that create or control fire and lightning to smite their foes, and they are quick to follow their impulses and passions into action without much forethought. Life to a goblin is an adventure full of new things to explore and experience.

entries.name: Long Arms and Stony Skin
entries: A typical goblin stands between three-and-a-half and five feet tall, with a slender, elongated build. Goblins' arms are unusually long and spindly, making them adept at climbing cliffs and trees. Their skin has a stony texture, ranging in color from red-brown to moss green or gray. Their ears are large and swept back, their eyes are intensely red, and many sport heavy bone protrusions on their spines or elbows. Males have similar growths jutting from their chins, while females have heavier growths on their foreheads.

This distinctive appearance is a direct result of the goblins' unusual diet. Before the Eldrazi's rise, goblins supplemented their normal diet with a kind of rock they pounded into bits and called "grit." The presence of the Eldrazi in Zendikar has poisoned this rock, so the goblins have taken to eating powdered hedrons instead. Eating this magic-infused stone has given the goblins resistance to the maddening psychic emanations of the Eldrazi. As an added benefit, it toughens their skin, protecting them from the elements and from physical dangers.

Smaller and weaker than their cousins, and with larger hands and feet, goblins of the Grotag tribe attempt to live by their wits—though seldom with much success. When a Grotag goblin has the bright idea of trying to tame fleshpiercer mites, at least a few others will be willing to follow that goblin into a nest—usually to predictably horrible results. But though the Grotag seem to have a never-ending supply of bad ideas, and a horrible ratio of bad ideas to good, the Grotag likewise seem to have a never-ending supply of Grotag. As such, by trial and error (and more error), these goblins have stumbled across a great deal of knowledge useful for surviving the deep places of Zendikar, and for dealing with the creatures that live there. The Grotag imagine themselves to have a sort of empathy with beasts, and they lose hundreds of goblins each year to ill-advised attempts at monster taming. But, every now and again, one of these efforts is successful.

The Lavastep tribe is the most industrious of the goblin tribes, and possesses much hard-won knowledge of the geothermal activity in Akoum. More so than members of the other tribes, the Lavastep goblins build surprisingly effective equipment out of the crystal shards and veins of strange metals that occasionally boil up to the surface. The most warlike of their kind, Lavastep goblins frequently harass the kor, elves, and humans of Akoum.

Among the goblins, the Tuktuk are most likely to hire themselves out as ruin guides to other races. Of course, their usual plan is to help find something of value, steal it, trigger a trap intentionally, and then run.

在最高的山峰之上──遠高那樹木能夠生長的斜坡、在那空氣稀薄，寒風呼嘯的所在──哥利亞隱居於此。很少有人能夠聲稱他們見過歌利亞，而能夠聲稱與他們建立友誼的人則更為稀少。歌利亞漫步於岩石、冰冷和狂風的荒涼地帶。他們那看上去如同從山石中彫琢而成的軀體帶給了他們強大的力量。他們的靈魂則如同漂泊的風，讓他們成為了在群山之間四處流浪。他們的心中充盈著對他們嚴酷地域的冰冷敬重，這使每個歌利亞都有責任在部族中爭取自己的一席之地，至死方休。

entries.name: 被驅使的競爭者
entries: 每一天的開始都會為歌利亞人帶來新的挑戰。食物、水、和庇護所在高山上十分稀少。一次微小的錯誤就可能為整個部落帶來滅頂之災，然而一個人的英勇努力也可能足以確保整個部族的生存。
也因此，歌利亞相當重視自給自足和個人技藝。他們擁有一種持續記錄的衝動，用以衡量自己的行為，並將自己的成就與他人比較。歌利亞喜愛勝利，但他們也將失敗看作是提高他們技術的一種刺激。
但這種對致力於競爭的態度也有其壞處。歌利亞是兇猛的競爭者，而最重要的是，他們會被強烈驅使去超越以往的努力。如果一名歌利亞殺死了一條龍，那麼他或她將可能會去找尋一條更大、更強壯的飛龍加以挑戰。很少有歌利亞冒險者能活到晚年，他們大都在嘗試超越過去成就的過程中死去。

entries.name: 公平競爭
entries: 對歌利亞而言，競爭只有在公平環境下才會存在。他們的競爭衡量了才能、以及為其奉獻的時間和精力。這些要素決定了他們在其家鄉土地上能否生存下來，而非依賴魔法物品、金錢、和其他以各種方式打破平衡的要素。歌利亞會欣然地利用這些優勢，但他們會小心謹慎，牢記這類優勢永遠有機會逝去。一名過分依賴這些優勢的歌利亞會變得驕矜自滿，而這在山中往往意味著災難。
這個特質在歌利亞與其他種族交流時尤其明顯。農民與貴族之間的關係讓歌利亞人感到困惑。如果一個國王缺乏領導的智慧，那麼很明顯的，這個王國中最有才華的人就應該取而代之。歌利亞很少會將這些想法藏在心裡，且他們會嘲笑那些依賴社會結構或規則來維持權力的傢夥。

entries.name: 適者生存
entries: 在歌利亞的社會中，任何無法為部落做出貢獻的成年人都會被驅逐。一個孤獨的歌利亞幾乎沒有生存下來的機會，而那些年老或弱小的個體更是如此。歌利亞對那些無法自理的成年人幾乎沒有一絲憐憫，儘管出於公平競爭的觀念，他們仍會照料染病或受傷的人。
一個受到永久性創傷的歌利亞仍被期許在部落中發揮自己的影響力。通常來說，這些歌利亞會在試圖跟上部族的過程中死去，或在夜晚悄悄離開，以接受命運的殘酷意志。
在某種程度上，歌利亞那驅使自己超越自我的衝動，也不可避免地助長了他們邁向衰落和死亡的可怕命運。一名歌利亞寧願在力量和技藝都處於巔峰時在戰鬥中死去，也不願忍受年老的緩慢衰朽。很少有人見過年老的歌利亞，即使是那些離開了自己部族的歌利亞，也會在他們的身體技藝衰退時掙紮著對抗那放棄生命的衝動。
由於他們高風險的生活方式，歌利亞部落長久以來都缺乏由長期領導者所提供的經驗。他們希望他們的領袖生來充滿智慧，因為他們很少能依靠那隨著年齡增長而獲得的智慧。

entries.name: 歌利亞姓名
entries: 每個歌利亞都有三個名字：一個由新生兒父母取的出生名，一個由部落酋長給予的綽號，和一個家族或氏族的名字。出生名通常有著最多三個音節的長度，而氏族名則為五個或更多的音節，並以元音結尾。
出生名很少與性別有關。歌利亞認為男性和女性在所有事情上都是平等的，且他們認為按性別劃分角色的社會是令人困惑或值得嘲笑的。對於歌利亞來說，最擅長一項工作的人就應該是負責這項工作的人。
歌利亞的綽號是一段描述詞，且可能會隨著部落酋長或長老的一時興起而改變。它通常描述了一件由這名歌利亞所做出的，無論成敗都相當引人註目的行為。歌利亞也會為他們其他種族的朋友取綽號，並因為他們做出的驚人之舉而改變它們。
歌利亞在介紹自己身份時，會按照出生名、綽號、和氏族名的順序完整說出這三個名字。在非正式的談話中，他們則使用自己的綽號。

entries: 行走在兩個世界，卻不真正屬於任何一方，半精靈結合了他們精靈和人類雙親中最優秀的特質：人類的好奇心、創造力、和野心，並調和以精靈的敏銳感官、藝術修養、和對自然的熱愛。有些半精靈和人類生活在一起，卻因為他們情感和生理上的差異與人類產生隔閡，並因為歲月較少影響他們，而得看著朋友和愛人逐漸老去。其他半精靈則與精靈一起生活，在他們同儕仍做為孩童生活時早早成年，在永恆不變的精靈國度中變得越發焦躁不安。許多無法適應人類或精靈社會的半精靈會選擇孤獨流浪的生活，或加入其他不合群者一同踏上冒險生涯。

entries.name: 兩個世界的傳承
entries: 對人類來說，半精靈看起來就像精靈，而對精靈而言，他們則更像人類。他們的身高與其雙親相同，但他們既不如精靈那般纖瘦，也不像人類那樣厚實。他們的身高介於5呎到大約6呎高，且重量分布自100到180磅，且男性只比女性略高略重一些。半精靈的男性長有面部毛髮，且有時候會刻意留長鬍鬚以掩蓋自己的精靈血統。半精靈的膚色、髮色和容貌介於其人類和精靈雙親之間，並因此展現出相較於其他種族更多樣化的外觀特徵。他們通常會擁有一對與他們精靈親屬相近的雙眼。

entries.name: 使節或浪人
entries: 半精靈並沒有自己的國家，但他們在人類的城市中受到歡迎，而精靈的森林就對他們相對冷淡一些。在大城市中人類和精靈頻繁接觸的區域，半精靈的數量有時候會足夠形成他們自己的小社群。他們喜歡與其他半精靈相處，因為只有他們自己的同胞才能真正理解生活在兩族夾縫之間的艱辛。
然而在大部分的世界中，半精靈的數量極為稀少，以至於一名半精靈可能好幾年都無法遇見另一個半精靈。有些半精靈傾向於避免與他人接觸，孤身遊蕩於荒野中。和精靈一樣，他們被來自長生壽命的探索欲給驅使著，並因此成為護林人、獵人、或冒險者，鮮少造訪文明地帶。而其他半精靈則正好相反，他們投身於人口密集的社會，巧妙地利用他們的魅力和社交技巧以擔當外交官或詐欺犯的角色。

entries.name: 半精靈姓名
entries: 半精靈使用人類或精靈的取名習慣。就如同強調著他們並不真正屬於任何一方，在人類社會中成長的半精靈通常會被賦予精靈名字，而在精靈社會中被扶養長大的則經常會被取人類的名字。

entries.name: 優秀的使節
entries: 許多半精靈在年輕時便學會與所有人相處的技巧，善於消除敵意並找到雙方的共識。身為半精靈種族，他們繼承了精靈的優雅卻沒有精靈的冷漠，繼承了人類的活力卻沒有人類的粗野。他們經常會成為優秀的使節和調停人（但他們在面對精靈和人類之間的衝突時無能為力，因為雙方都懷疑半精靈會偏袒另一方）。

無論是在強大魔導師的領導下聯合，或是在多年的衝突下陷入僵局，獸人和人類有時會結成同盟，統合成一個更大的部落以成為鄰近文明國家的恐懼。當這些同盟透過聯姻而建立時，半獸人便隨之降生。有些半獸人會利用他們人類血統所帶來的優勢，戰勝其純血獸人競爭者並崛起成為獸人部落中的酋長。有些則會冒險走入世界，並向人類和其他文明種族證明自己的價值。他們之中許多成為了冒險者，因其強大的力量成就偉業、或因為他們的野蠻習俗和野性狂怒而招來惡名。

entries.name: 傷痕與強壯
entries: 半獸人傾斜的額頭，突出的下顎，牙齒外露，和高大的身材都使他們的獸人血統顯而易見。半獸人的身高介於6至7呎高，且通常重約180到250磅。
獸人將戰鬥留下的傷疤視作榮譽的象徵，並將裝飾性的傷痕視為美麗的事物。但有些其他傷痕則象徵著獸人或半獸人曾身為奴隸、或被放逐的恥辱過去。任何曾生活在獸人之中或其附近的半獸人都留有各種疤痕，無論是做為恥辱或榮譽的標記，這些傷疤都記述著他們過去的輝煌成就與創傷。這類半獸人在與人類一同生活時，可能會驕傲地展現這些傷痕、或羞愧地將其隱藏起來。

entries.name: 格烏什的印記
entries: 獨眼之神格烏什創造了獸人，且即使是那些改變信仰的獸人們也無法完全逃離祂的影響。這對半獸人也一樣，儘管他們的人類血統的確緩和了他們獸人遺傳的影響。有些半獸人仍會在夢中聽見格烏什的低語，呼喚他們釋放其體內醞釀的狂暴。其他半獸人則會在他們加入混戰搏鬥時感受到格烏什的狂喜──而這可能會使他們激發出同樣的興奮喜悅、或讓他們因恐懼或厭惡而顫抖。半獸人並非天性邪惡，但無論他們最終選擇接受或是反抗，邪惡都確實盤據在他們的體內。

除了因格烏什的狂暴影響之外，半獸人有著強烈的情緒感受。狂暴並不只是加速他們的脈搏，更使熊熊燃燒著他們的身軀。一聲辱罵就如強酸般使人刺痛，而悲傷則會削弱他們的力量。他們歡樂時會盡情狂笑，而單純的肉體滿足──像是大吃大喝、摔跤搏鬥、打鼓跺腳、和狂野舞蹈──則會使他們的心中充滿喜悅。他們往往脾氣暴躁，且有時會鬱鬱寡歡，更傾向於行動而非沉思，且寧可訴諸武力而非動口爭吵。那些最成功的半獸人往往是那些有著足夠自制力以在文明國家中生存的個體。

entries.name: 部落與貧民窟
entries: 絕大部分的半獸人和獸人居住在一起。而在其他種族之中，人類是最有可能會接受半獸人的族群，且那些不與獸人同住的半獸人們幾乎總是生活在人類的國家中。無論是為了證明自己而混跡在粗野的野蠻人部落，或是為了生存而在大城市的貧民窟裡摸索，半獸人透過他們的蠻力、耐力、以及從人類血統中繼承來的純粹毅力和決心而努力活著。

entries.name: 半獸人姓名
entries: 半獸人通常使用符合其成長環境文化的名字。一個希望與人類融洽相處的半獸人可能會將獸人名換成人類的名字。而一些擁有人類名字的獸人則可能會為了讓自己更富威懾力，而採用一個帶喉音的獸人名。

entries.name: 勉強而來的認同
entries: 每個半獸人都會找到某種方式以獲取那些憎恨獸人之人的認同。他們有些沉默寡言，嘗試不引起太多註意。有些會盡可能地公然展示自己的虔誠和善心（無論這些展現是否真誠）。而另外有些則是單純嘗試表現得強硬，好讓所有人都不敢惹他。
大部分半身人的人生目標就是待在舒適安穩的家：一個遠離劫掠怪物和徵戰軍隊、平靜安寧的居所；對著溫暖的火爐，三餐溫飽，把酒言歡。儘管有些半身人終其一生都在偏遠農邨中度過，其他人則被開闊大道和一望無際的地平線給吸引，加入旅程無盡的遊牧隊伍去見識那些嶄新土地與民族的美好。即使是這些四海遊蕩的旅行者仍然熱愛著和平、美食、火爐、和家園－－儘管他們的家園可能僅僅是那行駛於泥濘小徑的馬車、或漂泊於河道上的船筏。

entries.name: 矮小而實際
entries: 身型嬌小的半身人會避免引人註目而捲入爭鬥，並藉此在遍布大個子種族的世界中存活。他們身高約莫3呎，看上去人畜無害，並因此在大國興衰、戰亂、政治糾紛的夾縫間生存幾百年。他們身體普遍結實，體重介於40到45磅之間。
半身人的膚色涵蓋了古銅色到透紅的白皙，且他們的頭髮則通常捲曲且呈現褐色或沙棕色。他們有著褐色或淡棕色的雙眼。半身人經常蓄著長長的鬢毛卻很少留著鬍子。他們喜歡穿著簡單、舒適、和實用的衣物，且偏好明亮的色彩。
半身人講究實用的個性不僅僅體現在衣著上。他們關心著基本的生活所需和單純的娛樂，且鮮少鋪張炫燿。即使是最富裕的半身人都寧可將他們的財寶鎖在地窖，而非展現出來供人觀賞。在遇到難題時，他們擅長找出最簡單而直接的解決方式，容不下優柔寡斷。

entries.name: 和善而好奇
entries: 半身人是友善而樂觀的族群。他們珍視家族羈絆、友情、以及家園的溫暖與舒適，而鮮少懷抱金錢或榮燿的夢想。即便是他們之中的冒險者，也通常是因為群體、友情、探索、或好奇心等理由而踏上探索世界的旅程。他們熱愛發掘新事物，即使是最最單純的小事，例如一份異國美食、或是一套風格奇異的衣著都會勾起他們的興趣。
半身人有著強烈的同情心，且討厭看到任何活著的生物受到折磨。他們慷慨大方，即便自己經濟拮據仍樂於與他人分享自己的財富。

entries.name: 融入人群
entries: 半身人善於融入人類、矮人、或精靈的社群之中，展現自己的價值並受到歡迎。他們隱匿與謙遜的天性也幫助半身人們避免惹上不必要的註意。
半身人樂意與他人合作，且無論對方是否同為半身人，他們都忠於他們的友人。當他們的朋友、家人、或群體受到威脅時，他們也會展現出非比尋常的勇猛。

entries.name: 田園之樂
entries: 大部分的半身人們都生活在小而和平，且有著大片農田和井然果園的聚落。他們鮮少建立自己的王國、或甚至佔有超出他們寧靜小窩太多的土地。他們通常不會承認任何半身人的貴族或王室，而是尋求家族長者以引導他們。無論帝國如何興亡，他們的家族仍維持著他們的傳統生活。
許多半身人與其他的種族一起生活，並透過辛勞工作與忠誠的態度為他們贏取安穩富足的生活。有些半身人族群則把旅行作為一種生活方式，駕駛篷車或小船從這地到那地，居無定所，四處流浪。

entries.name: 積極而友好
entries: 半身人總是嘗試與所有人好好相處，且不太喜歡將事情一概而論──尤其是那些負面的刻板的印象。

entries.name: 矮人
entries: 「矮人們是忠實的朋友，且他們總是說話算話。不過要他們笑一笑就好像會傷害他們一樣。」

entries.name: 精靈
entries: 「他們是這麼美麗！他們的臉蛋、他們的音樂、優雅、以及所有一切。他們就好像是從美夢中走出來一樣。但沒有人知道他們微笑背後發生了什麼事──但我肯定比他們所說的更多。」

entries.name: 人類
entries: 「人類跟咱們很像，真的。至少他們之中的不少人是這樣。走出城堡和要塞，跟那些農夫和牧民聊聊，你將會發現他們是多麼善良而純樸的一群人。並不是說那些男爵和衛士有什麼不對──你不得不欽佩他們的信念，他們在保護自己領土的同時，也保護了我們。」

entries.name: 探索機緣
entries: 半身人通常會為了守護自己的群族、幫助他們的朋友、或探索這片充滿驚喜的廣闊世界而踏上冒險者的道路。對他們來說，冒險並不是一份事業，而是一份機運、有時更甚至是某種需求。

entries.name: 半身人姓名
entries: 一名半身人會有自己的名字、家族名、有時還會有一個暱稱。他們的家族名通常是源自某個讓人印象深刻的暱稱，並因此一代代的流傳下來。
